<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 90PT; FONT-SIZE: 14PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; MARGIN-RIGHT: 90PT">
<FONT STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PX">
	&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PX">
	&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	CRH MEDICAL CORPORATION
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 90PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PX">
	&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 1PX">
	&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	Years ended December 31, 2015 and 2014
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 90PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 90PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 90PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 90PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 90PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage56"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 14PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	MANAGEMENT'S REPORT
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The accompanying consolidated financial statements of CRH Medical Corporation are the responsibility of management and have been approved by the Board of Directors.&#160; The consolidated financial statements have been prepared by management in accordance with International Financial Reporting Standards, as issued by the International Accounting Standards Board, and where appropriate, reflect management's best estimates and assumptions based upon information available at the time that these estimates and assumptions were made.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Management is responsible for establishing and maintaining a system of internal controls over financial reporting designed to provide reasonable assurance as to the reliability of financial information and the safeguarding of assets.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Board of Directors is responsible for ensuring that management fulfills its responsibility for financial reporting and internal control.&#160; The Board of Directors exercises this responsibility principally through the Audit Committee.&#160; The Audit Committee consists of directors not involved in the daily operations of the Company.&#160; The Audit Committee is responsible for engaging the external auditor, and meets with management and the external auditors to satisfy itself that management's responsibilities are properly discharged and to review the financial statements prior to their presentation to the Board of Directors for approval.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company's external auditors, who are appointed by the shareholders, conducted an independent audit in accordance with Canadian generally accepted auditing standards and express their opinion thereon.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

<EFX_AUDITORS_OPINION>
<A NAME="FIS_AUDITORS_OPINION_2"></A>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 14PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; MARGIN-RIGHT: 54PT">
	INDEPENDENT AUDITORS' REPORT
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 54PT">
	To the Shareholders of CRH Medical Corporation
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	We have audited the accompanying consolidated financial statements of CRH Medical Corporation, which comprise the consolidated balance sheets as at December 31, 2015 and December 31, 2014, the consolidated statements of operations and comprehensive income, changes in equity and cash flows for the years then ended, and notes, comprising a summary of significant accounting policies and other explanatory information.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Management's Responsibility for the Consolidated Financial Statements
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Management is responsible for the preparation and fair presentation of these consolidated financial statements in accordance with International Financial Reporting Standards as issued by the International Accounting Standards Board, and for such internal control as management determines is necessary to enable the preparation of consolidated financial statements that are free from material misstatement, whether due to fraud or error.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Auditors' Responsibility
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Our responsibility is to express an opinion on these consolidated financial statements based on our audits. We conducted our audits in accordance with Canadian generally accepted auditing standards. Those standards require that we comply with ethical requirements and plan and perform the audit to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the consolidated&#160;financial statements are free from material misstatement.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	An audit involves performing procedures to obtain audit evidence about the amounts and disclosures in the consolidated financial statements. The procedures selected depend on our judgment, including the assessment of the risks of material misstatement of the consolidated financial statements, whether due to fraud or error. In making those risk assessments, we consider internal control relevant to the entity's preparation and fair presentation of the consolidated financial statements in order to design audit procedures that are appropriate in the circumstances, but not for the purpose of expressing an opinion on the effectiveness of the entity's internal control.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	An audit also includes evaluating the appropriateness of accounting policies used and the reasonableness of accounting estimates made by management, as well as evaluating the overall presentation of the consolidated&#160;financial statements.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	We believe that the audit evidence we have obtained in our audits is sufficient and appropriate to provide a basis for our audit opinion.
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEFOOTER">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">

<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 33.33%">
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
</TD>

	Opinion
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In our opinion, the consolidated financial statements present fairly, in all material respects, the consolidated financial position of CRH Medical Corporation as at December&#160;31, 2015 and December&#160;31, 2014, and its consolidated financial performance and its consolidated&#160;cash flows for the years then ended in accordance with International Financial Reporting Standards

	&#160;

	as issued by the International Accounting Standards Board.

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	1.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT" ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Reporting entity:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	CRH Medical Corporation ("CRH" or "the Company") was incorporated on April&#160;21, 2001 under the Company Act of the Province of British Columbia and specializes in the treatment of hemorrhoids utilizing its treatment protocol and patented proprietary technology.&#160; The Company also provides anesthesiology services to gastroenterologists in the southeastern United States through its subsidiaries (note 4).
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	CRH principally operates in the United States and is headquartered from its registered offices located at Unit 578, 999 Canada Place, Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The preparation of the Company's consolidated financial statements requires management to make judgments, estimates and assumptions that affect the application of accounting policies, the reported amounts of assets and liabilities, the disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities at the date of the financial statements and the reported amounts of revenues and expenses during the reporting period.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Reported amounts and note disclosures reflect the overall economic conditions that are most likely to occur and anticipated measures management intends to take.&#160; Actual results could differ from those estimates.

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">

	Estimates and underlying assumptions are reviewed on an ongoing basis.&#160; Revisions to accounting estimates are recognized in the period in which the estimates are revised and in any future periods affected.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 54PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Significant areas requiring the use of management estimates relate to the assessment for impairment and useful lives of intangible assets, determining the fair value of share units, estimates supporting reported anesthesia revenues, the recoverability of trade receivables, the valuation of certain long term liabilities and other assets, including liabilities relating to contingent consideration, the vesting term for share units with market based performance targets, the valuation of acquired intangibles, the valuation of deferred tax assets and the allocation of purchase consideration to the fair value of assets acquired and liabilities assumed.
</DIV>

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

	Years ended&#160;December 31, 2015 and 2014
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 10.25PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 9PT">
<HR STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PX; MARGIN-RIGHT: AUTO" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT">

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	3.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT" ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Significant accounting policies:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The accounting policies have been applied consistently by the subsidiaries of the Company.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(a)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT" ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Basis of consolidation:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	These consolidated financial statements include the accounts of the Company and its subsidiaries. Subsidiaries are entities controlled by the Company. Control exists when the Company has power over an investee, when the Company is exposed, or has rights, to variable returns from the investee and when the Company has the ability to affect those returns through its power over the investee. Subsidiaries are included in the consolidated financial results of the Company from the effective date of acquisition up to the effective date of disposition or loss of control.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(b)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT" ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Cash equivalents:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company considers all highly liquid investments with an original maturity of 90 days or less, when acquired, to be cash equivalents, which are carried at amortized cost and are classified as loans and receivables.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(c)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT" ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Foreign currency:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Transactions in foreign currencies are translated to the respective functional currencies of the subsidiaries of the Company at exchange rates at the dates of the transactions.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Period end balances of monetary assets and liabilities in foreign currency are translated to the respective functional currencies using period end foreign currency rates.&#160; Foreign currency gains and losses arising from settlement of foreign currency transactions are recognized in earnings.&#160; Non-monetary assets and liabilities denominated in foreign currencies that are measured at fair value are translated to the functional currency at the exchange rate at the date on which the fair value was determined. Non-monetary items that are measured at historical cost in a foreign currency are translated using the exchange rate at the date of the transaction.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;(d)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 5.4PT" ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Revenue recognition:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Revenue from product sales and anesthesia services in the normal course of activities is measured at the fair value of the consideration received or receivable, net of returns, trade discounts and contractual adjustments.&#160; The Company recognizes revenue from product sales at the time the product is shipped, which is when title passes to the customer, and when all significant contractual obligations have been satisfied, collection is probable and the amount of revenue can be estimated reliably.&#160; Revenue from the performance of anesthesia services is measured at the fair value of the consideration received or receivable, net of contractual allowances and other discounts.&#160; The Company recognizes net patient revenue at the time the anesthesia services are performed; this aligns with when all significant contractual obligations related to the anesthesia services have been satisfied, collection is probable and the amount of revenue can be estimated reliably.&#160; Provisions for contractual allowances and discounts are recognized on an accrual basis.&#160; These amounts are deducted from gross service revenue to determine net service revenue.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEFOOTER">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
	7
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage66"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 20.5PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 18PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	CRH MEDICAL CORPORATION
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Consolidated Balance Sheets
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(Expressed in United States dollars)
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 10.25PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 9PT">
	Years ended&#160;December 31, 2015 and 2014
</DIV>

	3.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT" ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Significant accounting policies (continued):
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;(e)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 5.4PT" ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Employee benefits:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="7EC518B6B64047488B14B472C6B77E17" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	i
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	Salaries and short-term employee benefits:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 54PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Salaries and short-term employee benefit obligations are measured on an undiscounted basis and are expensed as the related service is provided.&#160; A liability is recognized for the amount expected to be paid under cash bonus plans if the Company has a legal or constructive obligation to pay an amount as a result of services rendered by an employee and the obligation can be estimated reliably.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(f)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT" ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Inventories:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Inventories are measured at the lower of cost, determined using the first-in first-out method, and net realizable value.&#160; Inventory costs include the purchase price and other costs directly related to the acquisition of inventory, and bringing the inventories to their present location and condition.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Net realizable value is the estimated selling price in the Company's ordinary course of business, less the estimated costs of completion and selling expenses.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Property and equipment are measured at cost less accumulated depreciation and accumulated impairment losses.&#160; Where the costs of certain components of an item of property and equipment are significant in relation to the total cost of the item and have different useful lives, they are accounted for and depreciated separately.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	These depreciation methods most closely reflect the expected pattern of consumption of the future economic benefits embodied in the asset.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Estimates for depreciation methods, useful lives and residual values are reviewed at each reporting period-end and adjusted if appropriate.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;(h)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 5.4PT" ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Intangible assets:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Intangible assets, consisting of acquired exclusive professional service agreements to provide anesthesia services and the cost of acquiring patents, are recorded at historical cost.&#160; For patents, costs also include legal costs involved in expanding the countries in which the patents are recognized to the extent expected cash flows from those countries exceed these costs over the amortization period and costs related to new patents.&#160; Intangible assets with finite lives are amortized on a straight-line basis over their estimated useful lives and are measured at cost less accumulated amortization and accumulated impairment losses.&#160; Intangible assets with finite lives are amortized over the following periods:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>

	Intellectual property new technology
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF; WIDTH: 30%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Straight-line
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF; WIDTH: 30%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	20 years
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>

<TD STYLE="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF; WIDTH: 40%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
	9
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage68"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 20.5PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 18PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	CRH MEDICAL CORPORATION
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Consolidated Balance Sheets
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(Expressed in United States dollars)
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 10.25PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 9PT">
	Years ended&#160;December 31, 2015 and 2014
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 10.25PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 9PT">
<HR STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PX; MARGIN-RIGHT: AUTO" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	3.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT" ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Significant accounting policies (continued):
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(i)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT" ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Financial instruments:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Financial assets and financial liabilities are initially measured at fair value and are subsequently measured based on their classification as described below.&#160; Transaction costs that are directly attributable to the acquisition or issuance of a financial asset or liability, other than financial assets and liabilities classified at fair value through earnings, are added or deducted from the fair value of the respective financial asset or financial liability on initial recognition.&#160; Transaction costs that are directly attributable to the acquisition of a financial asset or financial liability classified at fair value through earnings are recognized immediately in earnings.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Financing fees related to debt are capitalized to other assets and amortized to finance costs over the term of the credit facility.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Financial assets and liabilities are offset and the net amount is reported in the balance sheet when there is a legally enforceable right to offset the recognized amounts and there is an intention to settle on a net basis or realize the asset and settle the liability simultaneously.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company's financial instruments are classified into the following categories: at fair value through earnings, loans and receivables, available for sale financial assets and other financial liabilities.&#160; The classification depends on the nature and purpose of the financial instrument and is determined at the time of initial recognition.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Financial assets at fair value through earnings are financial assets that are held for trading and include derivative instruments that are not included in a qualifying hedging relationship.&#160; Financial assets classified as financial assets at fair value through earnings are initially measured at fair value with any gains or losses arising on re-measurement recognized in earnings.&#160; The Company has no financial assets at fair value through earnings.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Financial liabilities classified as fair value through earnings are financial liabilities that are held for trading or designated into this category at inception.&#160; Financial liabilities classified as financial liabilities at fair value through earnings include complex financial instruments and contingent consideration and are initially measured at fair value with any gains or losses arising on re-measurement recognized through earnings.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Other financial liabilities includes trade payables, other payables, and note payables and bank indebtedness and are initially measured at fair value and are subsequently measured at amortized cost using the effective interest method.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEFOOTER">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
	10
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage69"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 20.5PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 18PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	CRH MEDICAL CORPORATION
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Consolidated Balance Sheets
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(Expressed in United States dollars)
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 10.25PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 9PT">
	Years ended&#160;December 31, 2015 and 2014
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 10.25PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 9PT">
<HR STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PX; MARGIN-RIGHT: AUTO" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	3.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT" ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Significant accounting policies (continued):
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(i)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT" ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Financial instruments (continued):
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company has classified cash and cash equivalents, trade and other receivables as loans and receivables, and trade and other payables, employee benefit obligations, short term advances, loans and certain of its notes payable and bank indebtedness as other financial liabilities.&#160; Loans and receivables are initially measured at fair value and are subsequently re-measured at amortized cost using the effective interest method, less any impairment losses.&#160; The Company has classified certain of its notes payable and its earn-out obligation as financial liabilities at fair value through earnings.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Available-for-sale financial assets are non-derivative financial assets that are designated as available-for-sale and that are not classified in any of the other categories.&#160; Subsequent to initial recognition, they are measured at fair value and changes therein, other than impairment losses and foreign currency differences on available-for-sale debt instruments, are recognized in other comprehensive income and presented within equity.&#160; When an investment is derecognized, the cumulative gain or loss in other comprehensive income is transferred to earnings.&#160; The Company has no instruments classified as available for sale.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Financial assets are derecognized when the rights to receive cash flows from the assets have expired or have been transferred, and the Company has transferred substantially all of the risks and rewards of ownership.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(j)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT" ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Impairment:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Financial assets:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Financial assets not carried at fair value through earnings are assessed at each reporting date to determine whether there is objective evidence that they are impaired.&#160; The Company considers that a financial asset is impaired if objective evidence indicates that a loss event which negatively affected the estimated future cash flows, has occurred after initial recognition of the asset.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	An impairment test is performed, on an individual basis, for each material financial asset.&#160; Other individually non-material financial assets are tested as groups of financial assets with similar risk characteristics.&#160; Impairment losses are recognized in earnings.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	An impairment loss in respect of a financial asset measured at amortized cost is calculated as the difference between its carrying amount and the present value of the estimated future cash flows discounted at the asset's original effective interest rate. Losses are recognized in earnings and reflected in an allowance account against the respective financial asset. Interest on the impaired asset continues to be recognized through the unwinding of the discount.&#160; When a subsequent event causes the amount of impairment loss to decrease, the decrease in impairment loss is reversed through earnings.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	A permanent impairment loss for an available-for-sale investment is recognized by transferring the cumulative loss previously recognized in other comprehensive income to earnings.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEFOOTER">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
	11
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">

</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage70"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 20.5PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 18PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	CRH MEDICAL CORPORATION
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Consolidated Balance Sheets
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(Expressed in United States dollars)
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 10.25PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 9PT">
	Years ended&#160;December 31, 2015 and 2014
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 10.25PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 9PT">
<HR STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PX; MARGIN-RIGHT: AUTO" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	3.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT" ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Significant accounting policies (continued):
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(j)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT" ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Impairment (continued):
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Non-financial assets:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The carrying amounts of the Company's non-financial assets, other than inventories and deferred tax assets are reviewed at each reporting date to determine whether there is any indication of impairment.&#160; If such an indication exists, the recoverable amount is estimated.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The recoverable amount of an asset or a cash-generating unit is the greater of its value in use and its fair value less costs to sell.&#160; In assessing value in use, the estimated future cash flows are discounted to their present value using a pre-tax discount rate that reflects current market assessments of the time value of money and the risks specific to the asset.&#160; For the purpose of impairment testing, assets are grouped together into the smallest group of assets that generates cash inflows from continuing use that are largely independent of cash inflows from other assets or groups of assets (cash-generating unit). Impairment losses recognized in prior periods are assessed at each reporting date for any indications that the loss has decreased or no longer exists.&#160; An impairment loss is reversed if there has been a change in the estimates used to determine the recoverable amount.&#160; An asset's carrying amount, increased through reversal of an impairment loss, must not exceed the carrying amount that would have been determined, net of depreciation or amortization, if no impairment loss had been recognized.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(k)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT" ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Income taxes:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Income tax expense is comprised of current and deferred tax.&#160; Current tax and deferred tax are recognized into earnings except to the extent that it relates to a business combination, or items recognized directly in other comprehensive income.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Current tax is the expected tax payable or receivable on the taxable income or loss for the year, using tax rates enacted or substantively enacted at the reporting date, and any adjustment to tax payable in respect of previous years.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEFOOTER">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
	12
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">

</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage71"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 20.5PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 18PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	CRH MEDICAL CORPORATION
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Consolidated Balance Sheets
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(Expressed in United States dollars)
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 10.25PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 9PT">
	Years ended&#160;December 31, 2015 and 2014
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 10.25PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 9PT">
<HR STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PX; MARGIN-RIGHT: AUTO" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	3.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT" ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Significant accounting policies (continued):
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(k)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT" ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Income taxes (continued):
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Deferred tax is recognized in respect of temporary differences between the carrying amounts of assets and liabilities for financial reporting purposes and the amounts used for taxation purposes.&#160; Deferred tax is not recognized for the following temporary differences: the initial recognition of assets or liabilities in a transaction that is not a business combination and that affects neither accounting nor taxable earnings, and differences relating to investments in subsidiaries and jointly controlled entities to the extent that it is probable that they will not reverse in the foreseeable future.&#160; In addition, deferred tax is not recognized for taxable temporary differences arising on the initial recognition of goodwill.&#160; Deferred tax is measured at the tax rates that are expected to be applied to temporary differences when they reverse, based on the laws that have been enacted or substantively enacted by the reporting date.&#160; Deferred tax assets and liabilities are offset if there is a legally enforceable right to offset current tax liabilities and assets, and they relate to income taxes levied by the same tax authority on the same taxable entity, or on different tax entities, but they intend to settle current tax liabilities and assets on a net basis or their tax assets and liabilities will be realized simultaneously.&#160; A deferred tax asset is recognized for unused tax losses, tax credits and deductible temporary differences, to the extent that it is probable that future taxable profits will be available against which they can be utilized.&#160; Deferred tax assets are reviewed at each reporting date and are reduced to the extent that it is no longer probable that the related tax benefit will be realized.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(l)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT" ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Share-based compensation:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company records share-based compensation related to stock options and share units granted using the fair value based method estimated using either the Black-Scholes model or Binomial method.&#160; Under this method, compensation cost is measured at fair value at the date of grant and expensed, as employee benefits, over the period in which employees unconditionally become entitled to the award.&#160; The amount recognized as an expense is adjusted to reflect the number of awards for which the related service conditions are expected to be met, such that the amount ultimately recognized as an expense is based on the number of awards that do meet the related service and non-market performance conditions at the vesting date.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(m)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 5.4PT" ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Share capital:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Common shares are classified as equity. Incremental costs directly attributable to the issue of common shares and share options are recognized as a deduction from equity, net of any tax effects.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEFOOTER">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
	13
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage72"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 20.5PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 18PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	CRH MEDICAL CORPORATION
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Consolidated Balance Sheets
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(Expressed in United States dollars)
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 10.25PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 9PT">
	Years ended&#160;December 31, 2015 and 2014
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 10.25PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 9PT">
<HR STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PX; MARGIN-RIGHT: AUTO" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	3.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT" ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Significant accounting policies (continued):
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(n)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT" ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Earnings per share:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company presents basic and diluted earnings per share (EPS) data for its common shares.&#160; Basic EPS is calculated by dividing the net income or loss attributable to common shareholders of the Company by the weighted average number of common shares outstanding during the period, adjusted for own shares held, if applicable.&#160; Diluted EPS is determined by adjusting the income or loss attributable to common shareholders and the weighted average number of common shares outstanding, adjusted for own shares held if applicable, for the effects of all dilutive potential common shares.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(o)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT" ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Provisions:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Provisions are recognized if, as a result of a past event, the Company has a present legal or constructive obligation that can be estimated reliably, and it is probable that an outflow of resources will be required to settle the obligation.&#160; Provisions are determined by discounting expected future cash outflows at a pre-tax rate that reflects current market assessments of the time value of money and the risks specific to the liability.&#160; Management uses judgment to estimate the amount, timing and probability of the liability based on facts known at the reporting date.&#160; The unwinding of the discount is recognized as a finance expense.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(p)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT" ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Segment reporting:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company's operating segments consist of the sale of medical products and the provision of anesthesia services.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(q)&#160; Finance costs:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Finance cost is primarily comprised of interest on the Company's notes payable and bank indebtedness and also includes the amortization of costs incurred to obtain loan financing and any fees in respect of arranging loan financing. Deferred finance costs are amortized using the effective interest method over the term of the related loan financing.&#160; Deferred finance costs are presented as a reduction to the related liability.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Foreign exchange gains and losses are reported on a net basis as either finance income or finance expense as the finance costs relate to Canadian dollar denominated debt.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEFOOTER">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
	14
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage73"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 20.5PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 18PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	CRH MEDICAL CORPORATION
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Consolidated Balance Sheets
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(Expressed in United States dollars)
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 10.25PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 9PT">
	Years ended&#160;December 31, 2015 and 2014
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 10.25PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 9PT">
<HR STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PX; MARGIN-RIGHT: AUTO" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	3.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT" ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Significant accounting policies (continued):
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; TEXT-INDENT: 21.3PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(r)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 7.35PT" ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB">
	&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Business combinations:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Business combinations are accounted for using the acquisition method.&#160; The consideration for an acquisition is measured at the fair values of the assets transferred, the liabilities assumed and the equity interests issued at the acquisition date.&#160; The excess of the consideration over the fair value of the identifiable net assets acquired is recorded as goodwill.&#160; Transaction costs that are incurred in connection with a business combination, other than costs associated with the issuance of debt or equity securities, are expensed as incurred.&#160; On an acquisition-by-acquisition basis, any non-controlling interest is measured either at fair value of the non-controlling interest or at the fair value of the proportionate share of the net assets acquired.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Contingent consideration is measured at fair value on acquisition date and is included as part of the consideration transferred.&#160; The fair value of the contingent consideration liability is re-measured at each reporting date with the corresponding gain or loss being recognized in earnings.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(s)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT" ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Comparative information:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Certain comparative information has been reclassified to conform with the presentation adopted in the current fiscal year.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(t)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT" ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Adoption of new accounting standards:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company has not early adopted any amendment, standard or interpretation that has been issued by the IASB but is not yet effective. Amendments, standards and interpretations that are issued but not yet effective are described in note 3(u).
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="A78F1CA25F154A9E89E0035FD5253FC3" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 14.2PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.8PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#160;(u)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	New standards and interpretations not yet applied:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(i)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT" ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	IFRS 9
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	- Financial Instruments:
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 56.7PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	On July 24, 2014 the IASB issued the complete IFRS 9 (IFRS 9 (2014)).&#160; IFRS 9 (2014) introduces new requirements for the classification and measurement of financial assets. Under IFRS 9 (2014), financial assets are classified and measured based on the business model in which they are held and the characteristics of their contractual cash flows. The standard also introduces additional changes relating to financial liabilities and amends the impairment model by introducing a new 'expected credit loss' model for calculating impairment.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEFOOTER">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
	15
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

	Years ended&#160;December 31, 2015 and 2014
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 10.25PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 9PT">
<HR STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PX; MARGIN-RIGHT: AUTO" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	3.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT" ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Significant accounting policies (continued):
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="28F54681F12945858E7230F43DD231B5" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 14.2PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.8PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	(u)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	New standards and interpretations not yet applied:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(i)&#160; &#160; IFRS 9
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	- Financial Instruments:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 56.7PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	IFRS 9 (2014) also includes a new general hedge accounting standard which aligns hedge accounting more closely with risk management. This new standard does not fundamentally change the types of hedging relationships or the requirement to measure and recognize ineffectiveness, however it will provide more hedging strategies that are used for risk management to qualify for hedge accounting and introduce more judgment to assess the effectiveness of a hedging relationship.&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Special transitional requirements have been set for the application of the new general hedging model.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 56.7PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company intends to adopt IFRS 9 (2014) in its financial statements for the annual period beginning on January 1, 2018. The extent of the impact of adoption of the standard has not yet been determined.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="BB2F2B7CA4CF44B794EFB61904F522A1" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 35.45PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#160;(ii)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	Annual Improvements to IFRS (2012 &#8211; 2014):
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 56.7PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	On September 25, 2014 the IASB issued narrow-scope amendments to a total of four standards as part of its annual improvements process. The amendments will apply for annual periods beginning on or after January 1, 2016. Earlier application is permitted, in which case, the related consequential amendments to other IFRSs would also apply. Each of the amendments has its own specific transition requirements.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 56.7PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Amendments were made to clarify the following in their respective standards:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="A2A97517B2D444CFA9596A6F1C56CA62" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 71.85PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	Changes in method for disposal under IFRS 5 Non-current Assets Held for Sale and Discontinued Operations;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="216E7047CBFA46A79C576D2A2B69F2F6" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	'Continuing involvement' for servicing contracts and offsetting disclosures in condensed interim financial statements under IFRS 7 Financial Instruments: Disclosures;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="54B15650FCCF4C1BBDCE3EB839303B14" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

	Discount rate in a regional market sharing the same currency under IAS 19 Employee Benefits;
</TD>
</TR>

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="F65CC1B70BA24A5B9A1B6F1144BB52FF" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

	Disclosure of information 'elsewhere in the interim financial report' under IAS 34 Interim Financial Reporting;
</TD>
</TR>

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 56.7PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company intends to adopt these amendments in its financial statements for the annual period beginning on January 1, 2016. The Company does not expect the amendments to have a material impact on the financial statements.
</DIV>

</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage75"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 20.5PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 18PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	CRH MEDICAL CORPORATION
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Consolidated Balance Sheets
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(Expressed in United States dollars)
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 10.25PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 9PT">
	Years ended&#160;December 31, 2015 and 2014
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 10.25PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 9PT">
<HR STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PX; MARGIN-RIGHT: AUTO" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
