</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	3.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT" ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Significant accounting policies (continued):
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="E10DC1EAE166446994965E8232BC17C5" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 14.2PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.8PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	(u)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	New standards and interpretations not yet applied:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; TEXT-INDENT: -18.55PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 54PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(iii)&#160; Disclosure Initiative:&#160; Amendments to IAS 1 &#8211;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Presentation of Financial Statements:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 56.7PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	On December 18, 2014 the IASB issued amendments to IAS 1
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Presentation of Financial Statements
</FONT>
	as part of its major initiative to improve presentation and disclosure in financial reports (the "Disclosure Initiative").&#160; The amendments are effective for annual periods beginning on or after January 1, 2016. Early adoption is permitted.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 56.7PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	These amendments will not require any significant change to current practice, but will facilitate improved financial statement disclosures.&#160;
</FONT>
	The Company intends to adopt these amendments in its financial statements for the annual period beginning on January 1, 2016. The extent of the impact of adoption of the amendments has not yet been determined.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;(iv)&#160; IFRS 15 -
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Revenue Recognition:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 56.7PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	On May 28, 2014 the IASB issued IFRS 15
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Revenue from Contracts with Customers.
</FONT>
	&#160; The new standard is effective for annual periods beginning on or after January 1, 2018. Earlier application is permitted.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 56.7PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	IFRS 15 will replace IAS 11
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Construction Contracts
</FONT>
	, IAS 18
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Revenue,
</FONT>
	IFRIC 13
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Customer Loyalty Programmes
</FONT>
	, IFRIC 15
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Agreements for the Construction of Real Estate
</FONT>
	, IFRIC 18
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Transfer of Assets from Customers
</FONT>
	, and SIC 31
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Revenue &#8211; Barter Transactions Involving Advertising Services.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 56.7PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The standard contains a single model that applies to contracts with customers and two approaches to recognising revenue: at a point in time or over time. The model features a contract-based five-step analysis of transactions to determine whether, how much and when revenue is recognized.&#160; New estimates and judgmental thresholds have been introduced, which may affect the amount and/or timing of revenue recognized.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 56.7PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The new standard applies to contracts with customers. It does not apply to insurance contracts, financial instruments or lease contracts, which fall in the scope of other IFRSs.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 56.7PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company intends to adopt IFRS 15 in its financial statements for the annual period beginning on January 1, 2018. The extent of the impact of adoption of the standard has not yet been determined.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="02AF0D44815A45F3B881A307845511E9" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 35.45PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	(v)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	In January 2016, the IASB issued IFRS 16 &#8211; Leases, which supersedes IAS 17 &#8211; Leases. IFRS 16 establishes principles for the recognition, measurement, presentation and disclosure of leases. The standard establishes a single model for lessees to bring leases on-balance sheet while lessor accounting remains largely unchanged and retains the finance and operating lease distinctions. IFRS 16 is effective for annual periods beginning on or after January 1, 2019, with earlier adoption permitted, but only if also applying IFRS 15 &#8211; Revenue from contracts with Customers. The Company is currently evaluating the impact on IFRS 16 on its financial statements.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The value of the acquired intangible assets, being exclusive professional services agreements, have been determined on a provisional basis and relates to the acquisition of exclusive professional services agreements to provide professional anesthesia services.&#160; As at the acquisition dates, except for the AHP and John's Creek acquisitions, the exclusive professional services agreements renew annually unless notice of termination is received.&#160; For the AHP acquisition, as at the acquisition date, the exclusive professional services agreements had estimated remaining contractual terms varying from 0.7 to 2.8 years.&#160; For the John's Creek acquisition, the exclusive professional services agreement has an estimated remaining contractual term of 10 years and 11 months.&#160; The amortization terms for the remaining agreements are based upon contractual terms within the acquisition agreements.
</DIV>

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 10.25PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 9PT">
<HR STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PX; MARGIN-RIGHT: AUTO" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	4.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT" ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Business combinations (continued):
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	John's Creek
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In December 2015, a subsidiary of the Company entered into an asset purchase agreement to purchase certain assets of John's Creek Anesthesia, LLC ("John's Creek"), an anesthesia services provider in the Southeastern United States.&#160; The total purchase price under the asset purchase agreement was $1,200,000 and was paid via cash.&#160; The Company has obtained control over the business through its contractual ability to direct the relevant activities of the assets acquired.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	MGAA
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In December 2015, a subsidiary of the Company entered into an asset contribution and exchange agreement to acquire 65% of the ownership interest in Macon Gastroenterology Anesthesia Associates LLC ("MGAA"), an anesthesia services provider in the Southeastern United States.&#160; The total purchase price under the asset contribution and exchange agreement was $4,670,000 and was paid via cash. As part of the transaction, the Company also entered into an operating agreement between it and the non-controlling interest shareholders of MGAA which governs the operation of MGAA.&#160; As a result of the 65% ownership interest acquired and the operating agreement, the Company has acquired control of MGAA and, as a result, 100% of the financial results of MGAA has been included in the Company's consolidated financial statements from the date of acquisition. The non-controlling interest of $2,514,615 was determined based on 35% of the fair value of MGAA's net identifiable assets as estimated by the Company.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In conjunction with the acquisition, both the Company and the non-controlling interest shareholder contributed loans of $185,714 and $100,000, respectively.&#160; The terms of the loans are such that they will be repaid first, prior to any future distributions.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	KGAA
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In September 2015, a subsidiary of the Company entered into an asset contribution and exchange agreement to acquire 51% of the ownership interest in Knoxville Gastroenterology Anesthesia Associates LLC ("KGAA"), an anesthesia services provider in the Southeastern United States.&#160; The total purchase price under the asset contribution and exchange agreement was $6,818,352 and was paid via a combination of cash ($5,395,700) and common shares (375,612 common shares with a value at acquisition of $1,422,652). As part of the transaction, the Company also entered into an operating agreement between it and the non-controlling interest shareholders of KGAA which governs the operation of KGAA.&#160; As a result of the 51% ownership interest acquired and the operating agreement, the Company has acquired control of KGAA and, as a result, 100% of the financial results of KGAA has been included in the Company's consolidated financial statements from the date of acquisition. The non-controlling interest of $6,550,968 was determined based on 49% of the fair value of KGAA's net identifiable assets as estimated by the Company.&#160; One of the directors of the Company is an indirect shareholder of KGAA.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEFOOTER">
</DIV>

	ADH
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 17.85PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In August 2015, a subsidiary of the Company entered into an asset purchase agreement to purchase certain assets of Associates in Digestive Health LLC ("ADH"), an anesthesia services provider in the Southeastern United States.&#160; The total purchase price under the asset purchase agreement was $6,600,000 and was paid via cash.&#160; The Company has obtained control over the business through its contractual ability to direct the relevant activities of the assets acquired.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	AHP
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In March 2015, a subsidiary of the Company entered into an asset purchase agreement to purchase certain assets of two anesthesia services providers in the Southeastern United States (hereinafter referred to as "AHP").&#160; The total purchase price under the asset purchase agreement was $600,000.&#160; The Company has obtained control over the business through its contractual ability to direct the relevant activities of the assets acquired.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Subsequent to completion of the acquisition, the Company received notice of the closure, effective August 1, 2015, of one of the endoscopy centers to which the Company provides anesthesia services under an exclusive professional services agreement acquired through this acquisition.&#160; As a result of the closure, the Company has recorded an impairment charge for the full value of the affected professional services agreement intangible totaling $389,693.
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The following unaudited supplemental pro forma financial information presents information as if the acquisitions had been completed on January 1, 2015.&#160; The pro forma financial information presented below (unaudited) is for informational purposes only and is not indicative of the results of operations that would have been achieved if the acquisitions had taken place at the beginning of fiscal 2015. The pro forma financial information (unaudited) presented includes amortization charges for acquired intangible assets based on the values assigned in the purchase price allocation and excludes the effect of actual impairment charges recorded in the period.&#160;&#160; Were the acquisitions completed on January 1, 2015, revenue for the consolidated group would have been approximately $56.0 million and net income before tax would have been approximately $2.7 million.
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 20.5PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 18PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	CRH MEDICAL CORPORATION
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Consolidated Balance Sheets
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(Expressed in United States dollars)
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 10.25PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 9PT">
	Years ended&#160;December 31, 2015 and 2014
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 10.25PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 9PT">
<HR STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PX; MARGIN-RIGHT: AUTO" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	4.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT" ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Business combinations (continued):
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Gastroenterology Anesthesia Associates LLC ("GAA")
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	On December 1, 2014, a subsidiary of the Company entered into an acquisition agreement to purchase the business, assets and interests of Gastroenterology Anesthesia Associates LLC (the "LLC") and the business interest contained in a management services agreement held by another private entity ("GAAM"), together the combined business hereinafter referred to as "GAA".&#160; The total purchase price under the agreement was $58,623,000 paid at closing and up to an additional $14,655,000 payable within 4.5 years after closing based on the achievement of certain financial performance targets of GAA (the "Earn-out obligation"). As at December 31, 2014, the Company had estimated that potential payments in respect of the earn-out obligation will range from $11,981,000 to $14,655,000.&#160; The maximum total purchase price assuming achievement of all performance measures is $73,278,000.&#160; The earn-out obligation has been recorded at the net present value of its fair value as at the date of the acquisition and changes in the fair value are recorded through earnings (note 18).
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Included in these consolidated financial statements for the year ended December 31, 2014 for GAA were sales of $3,386,073 and net earnings before tax of $1,516,970.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	CRH has obtained control over GAA through its contractual ability to direct its relevant activities and its right to variable returns.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The following table summarizes the fair value of the consideration transferred and the fair values of the assets and liabilities acquired at the acquisition date.
</DIV>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_25"></A>
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="D6F3E5D89D964F97A1C93FA1700E81C4" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2PX SOLID; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BORDER-TOP: #000000 2PX SOLID" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2PX SOLID; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BORDER-TOP: #000000 2PX SOLID" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&#160;
</TD>

</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2PX SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BORDER-TOP: #000000 2PX SOLID" VALIGN="BOTTOM" NOWRAP="NOWRAP">
	&#160;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF; WIDTH: 88%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 10.25PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 9PT">
	Cash
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF; WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF; WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 10.25PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 9PT">
	$
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF; WIDTH: 9%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 10.25PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 9PT">
	58,623,000

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The value of the acquired intangible assets, being the exclusive professional services agreements, relates to the acquisition of exclusive professional services agreements to provide professional anesthesia services.&#160;&#160; As at the acquisition date, the exclusive professional services agreements had a remaining contractual term of 6 years and 11 months and can be renewed by agreement of both parties. The Company amortizes these contractual assets over a term of 12 years.

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Norrep Credit Opportunities Fund II, LP ("Crown Note")
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	On December 1, 2014, the Company entered into an agreement to borrow funds in the form of a subordinated note payable from Norrep Credit Opportunities Fund II, LP.&#160; At inception, the original amount of the note payable was CAD$22,500,000 (USD$19,863,000).&#160; The note bears interest at 12% per annum with a decrease to 10% upon repayment and performance in full of the Company's obligations under its senior credit agreement (see Scotia Facility).&#160; Interest on the note is payable on a quarterly basis beginning March 31, 2015, with the payment of the principal scheduled for June 1, 2018.&#160; In compensation for its services, the Company paid Crown a combination of cash CAD$1,350,000 (USD$1,191,780) and shares (2,000,000 common shares) in addition to reimbursement of legal costs in relation to issuance of the note.&#160; The Crown note is subordinate to the Scotia Facility. The note is classified as an other financial liability and recorded at amortized cost.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Bank of Nova Scotia ("Scotia Facility")
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	On November 24, 2015, the Company entered into a credit facility with the Bank of Nova Scotia.&#160; The facility, which has a maturity date of April 30, 2018, provides financing of up to $33,000,000.&#160; As at December 31, 2015, the Company had drawn $17,000,000 on the facility.&#160; The facility is repayable in full at maturity, with scheduled principal repayments on a quarterly basis beginning March 31, 2016 based upon the outstanding balance of the credit facility.&#160; The facility is a revolving credit facility which the Company may terminate at any time without penalty.&#160; The credit facility bears interest at a floating rate based on the US prime rate, LIBOR or bankers' acceptance rates plus an applicable margin.&#160; At December 31, 2015, the interest rate on the facility was LIBOR plus 2.75%. Commitment fees, legal fees directly related to the credit facility, and standby charges usual for borrowings of this nature were and are payable.&#160; The Scotia Facility replaced the Knight Note as the Company's senior debt agreement on extinguishment of the Note.&#160; The Facility is secured by the assets of the Company.&#160; The Company is required to maintain the following financial covenants in respect of the facility:
</DIV>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

<A NAME="eolPage87"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 20.5PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 18PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	CRH MEDICAL CORPORATION
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Consolidated Balance Sheets
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(Expressed in United States dollars)
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 10.25PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 9PT">
	Years ended&#160;December 31, 2015 and 2014
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 10.25PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 9PT">
<HR STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PX; MARGIN-RIGHT: AUTO" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	12.&#160; Notes payable (continued):
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	As at December 31, 2015, the Company was in compliance with all financial covenants relating to the Scotia Facility and Crown Note.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Knight Therapeutics Inc. ("Knight Note")
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	On December 1, 2014, the Company entered into an agreement to borrow funds in the form of a secured note payable from Knight Therapeutics Inc.&#160; At inception, the original amount of the note payable was $30,000,000.&#160; The note bore interest at 10% per annum.&#160; Interest on the note was payable on a quarterly basis beginning March 31, 2015.&#160; The earliest maturity date of the loan was December 1, 2016, but could be extended to December 1, 2017 if certain conditions were met.&#160; The agreement contained contractual clauses that required early repayment of a portion of the principal balance should the Company complete an equity financing.&#160; In compensation for its services, the Company paid Knight a combination of cash ($1,200,000) and shares (3,000,000 common shares) in addition to reimbursement of legal costs in relation to issuance of the note.&#160; The note was classified as an other financial liability and recorded at fair value through earnings.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	On March 25, 2015, in conjunction with the close of the Company's bought deal equity offering, the Company repaid $7,968,526 of the principal balance owing, with related interest of $251,063.&#160; The principal repayment satisfied the Company's contractual requirement to repay a portion of the outstanding principal balance should the Company complete an equity financing.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	On November 25, 2015, in conjunction with the Scotia Facility, the Company repaid in full the principal owing on the Knight debt ($22,031,474), with related interest, prepayment penalties and other extinguishment related costs of $1,778,707.&#160; As a result of the extinguishment of the Knight Note, the Company recorded finance expense of $1,812,521 representing the difference between the fair value of the loan at extinguishment and the consideration transferred to extinguish its financial obligations under the note.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT">
</DIV>

<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEFOOTER">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">

	Consolidated Balance Sheets
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(Expressed in United States dollars)
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 10.25PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 9PT">
	Years ended&#160;December 31, 2015 and 2014
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 10.25PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 9PT">
<HR STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PX; MARGIN-RIGHT: AUTO" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	12.&#160; Notes payable (continued):
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Knight Therapeutics Inc. &#8211; Annual Fee ("Knight Annual Fee")
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In accordance with the Knight Note agreement, the Company was obligated to pay an annual fee relating to a comfort letter provided by Knight in respect of the Company's earn-out obligation (note 4).&#160; This fee was recognized as a separate financial liability, and recorded at fair value based on the Company's best estimate of the amount to be paid, and subsequently measured at amortized cost.&#160; On extinguishment of the Knight Note, the Annual Fee Liability and the Company's requirement to pay an annual fee was also extinguished.&#160; The Company recorded an extinguishment gain of $53,574 in respect of the extinguishment of this liability in finance expense in the year.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Bloom Burton Healthcare Structured Lending Fund II ("Bloom Burton Facility")
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	On December 1, 2014, the Company entered into an unsecured facility agreement with Bloom Burton Healthcare Structured Lending Fund II ("Bloom Burton") with a maximum borrowing limit of $2,000,000.&#160; The facility bore interest at 12% per annum.&#160; Accrued interest was payable on the maturity date or the date of any voluntary prepayment of the loan.&#160; Full payment was required within 54 months after the first advance under the facility or at date mutually agreed between the Company and Bloom Burton.&#160; The facility was subordinate to the Knight note. The facility was classified as an other financial liability and recorded at amortized cost.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	On November 25, 2015, in conjunction with the Scotia Facility, the Company repaid in full the principal owing on the Bloom Burton facility ($2,000,000), with related interest of $236,712.&#160; As a result of the extinguishment of the Bloom Burton facility, the Company recorded finance expense of $58,562 representing the difference between the value of the facility at extinguishment and the consideration transferred to extinguish the Company's financial obligations under the facility.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The consolidated minimum loan payments (principal) for all loan agreements in the future are as follows:

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	14.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 5.14PT" ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Share capital:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(a)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT" ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Authorized:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	100,000,000 common shares without par value.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(b)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT" ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Issued and outstanding &#8211; common shares:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	On March 25, 2015, the Company closed a bought deal equity offering and over-allotment option of 7,000,000 and 1,050,000 common shares, respectively, at a price of $2.72 (CAD$3.40) per common share for gross proceeds of $21,865,893 (CAD$27,370,000). In connection with the offering, the underwriters were paid a 6% commission totaling approximately $1,311,954 (CAD$1,642,200) and received 241,500 broker warrants with a fair value of $249,149 (CAD$311,535).&#160; The broker warrants expire 18 months from the close date of the bought deal offering and have an exercise price of CAD$3.40.&#160; Additional share issuance costs of $299,230 (CAD$375,059) were incurred in relation to the offering.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	On September 10, 2015, the Company issued 375,612 common shares with a total value of $1,422,652 in connection with its acquisition of Knoxville Gastroenterology Anesthesia Associates LLC and incurred share issuance costs of $6,164.&#160; Refer to note 4.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	On September 17, 2015, the Company issued 140,795 common shares on the exercise of 140,795 broker warrants issued in connection with the Company's bought deal equity offering.&#160; Gross proceeds on exercise was $363,158 (CAD$478,703) and the fair value of the instruments exercised was $145,254 (CAD$181,625).
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company has recorded a deferred tax asset of $420,511 in relation to those share issuance costs incurred in relation to the share offering and issuance of shares during the year.&#160; The deferred tax asset has been offset against share capital.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(c)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT" ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Stock option plan:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Under the Company's Stock Option Plan, the Company may grant options to its directors, officers, consultants and eligible employees.&#160; The plan provides for the granting of stock options at the fair market value of the Company's stock at the date of grant, and the term of options range from two to ten years. The Board of Directors may, in its sole discretion, determine the time during which options shall vest and the method of vesting. All options under the Plan will be subject to vesting provisions determined by the Board of Directors, over a period of not less than 18 months, in equal portions on a quarterly basis. Options granted to consultants providing investor relations activities will vest at the end of 12 months or longer from the date of issuance.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT">

	For the year ended December 31, 2015, the Company recognized $291,834 (2014 - $362,239), in compensation expense as a result of stock options awarded and vested.&#160; Compensation expense is recorded in the consolidated statement of operations and comprehensive income and is allocated to product sales expenses (note 6), corporate expenses (note 7) and anesthesia expenses (note 5) on the same basis as the allocations of cash compensation.

	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2PX SOLID; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF; WIDTH: 18.67%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	There is no dividend yield because the Company does not pay, and does not plan to pay cash dividends on its common shares.&#160; The expected stock price volatility is based on the historical volatility of the Company's average monthly stock closing prices over a period equal to the expected life of each option grant.&#160; The risk-free interest rate is based on yields from Canadian Government Bond yields with a term equal to the expected term of the options being valued.&#160; The expected life of options represents the period of time that the options are expected to be outstanding based on historical data of option holder exercise and termination behavior.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; TEXT-INDENT: -21.8PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(d)&#160;&#160; Share unit plan:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In June 2014, the shareholders of the Company approved a Share Unit Plan.&#160;&#160; Employees, directors and eligible consultants of the Company and its designated subsidiaries are eligible to participate in the Share Unit Plan. In accordance with the terms of the plan, the Company will approve those employees, directors and eligible consultants who are entitled to receive share units and the number of share units to be awarded to each participant. Each share unit awarded conditionally entitles the participant to receive one common share of the Company upon attainment of the share unit vesting criteria.&#160; The vesting of share units is conditional upon the expiry of time-based vesting conditions or performance-based vesting conditions.&#160; Once the share units vest, the participant is entitled to receive the equivalent number of underlying common shares.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT">
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company issued 509,000 share units ("Time based share units") during the year ended December 31, 2015. Of these units, 429,000 units vest over a 4 year term, with 50% vesting on the second anniversary and 25% vesting on each of the third and fourth anniversaries and 80,000 units vest over 1.25 years.&#160; The weighted average fair value per unit granted in the period was $2.90 (CAD$4.03) based on the market value of the underlying shares at the date of grant.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The remaining 2,000,000 share units ("Performance based share units") vest upon the Company meeting certain market based performance targets and expire on February 20, 2020.&#160; The weighted average fair value of these units at the date of grant was $1.67 (CAD$2.09) per unit.&#160; The fair value of these share units was calculated as of the grant date using a binomial pricing model with the following weighted average assumptions:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

	During the year ended December 31, 2015, 1,000,000 of those units which vest upon the Company meeting certain market based performance targets vested.&#160; Upon vesting, the Company has recognized the expense relating to these units, in full, and issued 1,000,000 common shares.

</EFX_BALANCE_SHEET>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	For the year ended December 31, 2015, 661,899 options (2014 &#8211; 2,805,196) and 1,755,961 share units (2014 &#8211; nil) were excluded from the diluted weighted average number of common shares calculation.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The average market value of the Company's shares for purposes of calculating the dilutive effect of share options was based on quoted market prices for the period during which the options were outstanding.&#160; The treasury method is used to determine the calculation of dilutive shares.
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	At December&#160;31, 2015, the Company has tax losses of $nil (2014 - $1.9 million) from its Canadian operations and $2.1 million (2014 - $7.4 million) from its U.S.&#160;operations, available to reduce future years' income taxes.&#160; The U.S. tax losses expire from 2031 and beyond.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Realization of the deferred tax assets is dependent on several factors, including a presumption of future profitability, which is subject to uncertainty. The Company has assessed that it is probable that its deferred tax assets, including those related to net operating losses, will be realized.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	16. Capital disclosures:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company's objective in managing capital is to safeguard its ability to continue as a going concern and to sustain future development of the business.&#160; In the management of capital, the Company includes shareholders' equity, excluding accumulated other comprehensive loss.&#160; The Company's objective is met by retaining adequate equity to provide for the possibility that cash flows from assets will not be sufficient to meet future cash flow requirements.&#160; In order to maintain or adjust its capital structure, the Company may issue new shares.&#160; The Board of Directors does not establish quantitative return on capital criteria for management. The Company is not subject to any externally imposed capital requirements, but is subject to debt covenants in respect of its notes payable and bank indebtedness (note 12).&#160; The Company's overall strategy with respect to capital management remains unchanged from the year ended December&#160;31, 2014.
</DIV>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_37"></A>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage98"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 20.5PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 18PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	CRH MEDICAL CORPORATION
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Consolidated Balance Sheets
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(Expressed in United States dollars)
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 10.25PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 9PT">
	Years ended&#160;December 31, 2015 and 2014
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 10.25PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 9PT">
<HR STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PX; MARGIN-RIGHT: AUTO" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	18.&#160; Financial instruments:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company's financial instruments consist of cash and cash equivalents, trade and other receivables, trade and other payables, employee benefit obligations, short term advances, loans, notes payable and bank indebtedness, and the Company's earn-out obligation.&#160; The fair values of these financial instruments, except certain of the notes payable balances and the earn-out obligation, approximate carrying value because of their short-term nature. The Knight debt (note 12) and the earn-out obligation are classified as financial liabilities recorded at fair value through earnings.&#160; For all other debt balances, the fair value of these financial instruments approximates carrying value; the Scotia Facility is a floating rate instrument and due to the subordinate nature of the Crown Note, management has assessed that the carrying value of this fixed rate instrument reflects fair value.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	An established fair value hierarchy requires the Company to maximize the use of observable inputs and minimize the use of unobservable inputs when measuring fair value.&#160; A financial instrument's categorization within the fair value hierarchy is based upon the lowest level of input that is available and significant to the fair value measurement.&#160; There are three levels of inputs that may be used to measure fair value:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="24BFBDD9950443CFB4B2BBA93951E3B5" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 17PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 11PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	Level 1 - quoted prices (unadjusted) in active markets for identical assets or liabilities;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="98C88EF20C04408588E5EF2166E936AB" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 17PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 11PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	Level 2 - inputs other than quoted prices included within Level 1 that are observable for the asset or liability, either directly (i.e. as prices) or indirectly (i.e. derived from prices); and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="FA48D12C168F400C846092AA6CFC9739" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 17PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 11PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	Level 3 - inputs for the asset or liability that are not based on observable market data (unobservable inputs).
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 17.85PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The following financial assets and liabilities are measured at fair value on a recurring basis using quoted prices in active markets for identifiable assets (Level 1); significant other observable inputs (Level 2); and significant unobservable inputs (Level 3):
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>

<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BORDER-TOP: #000000 2PX SOLID" VALIGN="BOTTOM">

<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2PX SOLID; VERTICAL-ALIGN: MIDDLE" VALIGN="BOTTOM">

<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2PX SOLID; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&#160;

<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF; WIDTH: 9%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM" VALIGN="BOTTOM">

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company uses a probability weighted valuation technique in calculating the fair value of the Knight note payable and the earn-out obligation.&#160; This valuation technique includes inputs relating to estimated cash outflows under each arrangement and the use of a discount rate appropriate to the Company. As at December 31, 2015, the Company has used a discount rate of 4.42% in the valuation of its earn-out obligation.&#160; As the Knight Note was extinguished on November 25, 2015, no valuation of this note was required as at December 31, 2015.
</DIV>

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
	40

<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage99"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 20.5PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 18PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	CRH MEDICAL CORPORATION
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Consolidated Balance Sheets
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(Expressed in United States dollars)
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 10.25PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 9PT">
	Years ended&#160;December 31, 2015 and 2014
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 10.25PT; TEXT-INDENT: -9PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 9PT; FONT-SIZE: 9PT">
<HR STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PX; MARGIN-RIGHT: AUTO" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	18.&#160; Financial instruments (continued):
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company evaluates the inputs into the probability weighted valuation technique at each reporting period.&#160; The following describes the amendments made in the valuation of the above financial liabilities during the year ended December 31, 2015.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	During the year ended December 31, 2015, the Company revised certain of the assumptions underlying the fair value calculation of the earn-out obligation to account for changes in the underlying credit risk of the Company.&#160; The Company downward adjusted its discount rate from 18% to 4.42%.&#160; This revision resulted in an increase of $3,755,504 to the fair value of the earn-out obligation with the impact of the adjustments recorded through finance expense in the year.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Prior to extinguishment, the Company revised certain of the probabilities and assumptions underlying the fair value calculations of its Knight note to account for changes in the underlying credit risk of the Company and for changes in estimated cash outflows.&#160; The Company downward adjusted its discount rate from 18% to 14.67% and revised certain of its estimates around cash outflows under this instrument.&#160; These revisions resulted in an increase of $1,975,790 to the fair value of the Knight note with the impact of the adjustments recorded through finance expense in the year.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The fair value measurements are sensitive to the discount rate used in calculating the fair values.&#160; A 1% increase in the discount rate would reduce the fair value of the earn-out obligation by $336,832.&#160; &#160; During the year ended December 31, 2015, the Company recorded accretion expense of $3,084,353 (2014 - $362,834) and $1,272,494 (2014 - $101,928), respectively, in relation to these liabilities, reflecting the change in fair value of the liabilities that is attributable to credit risk.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT">
</DIV>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company's financial instruments are exposed to certain financial risks, including credit risk, liquidity risk and market risk.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(a)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT" ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Credit risk:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Credit risk is the risk of financial loss to the Company if counterparty to a financial instrument fails to meet its contractual obligations and arises principally from the Company's cash and cash equivalents, and trade receivables.&#160; The carrying amount of the financial assets represents the maximum credit exposure.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company limits its exposure to credit risk on cash and cash equivalents by placing these financial instruments with high-credit quality financial institutions and only investing in liquid, investment grade securities.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company has a number of individual customers and no one customer represents a concentration of credit risk.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The carrying amount of trade receivables is reduced through the use of an allowance account and the amount of the loss is recognized in the income statement within operating expenses.&#160; When a receivable balance is considered uncollectible it is written off against the allowance.&#160; Subsequent recoveries of amounts previously written off are credited against operating expenses in the income statement.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	No one customer accounts for more than 10% of the Company's consolidated revenue.&#160; Credit risk associated with the collection of receivables is considered low.&#160;
<FONT STYLE="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company establishes a provision for losses on accounts receivable if it is determined that all or part of the outstanding balance is uncollectable.&#160; Collectability is reviewed regularly and an allowance is established or adjusted, as necessary, using a combination of the specific identification method and historic collection patterns.&#160;
</FONT>
	The following table sets forth details of the age of receivables that are not overdue as well as an analysis of overdue amounts and related allowance for the doubtful accounts.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEFOOTER">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
	42

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(b)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT" ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Liquidity risk:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Liquidity risk is the risk that the Company will not be able to meet its financial obligations as they come due.&#160; The Company ensures that there is sufficient liquidity to meet its short-term business requirements, taking into account its anticipated cash flows from operations and its holdings of cash.&#160; The relative maturity in respect of contractual and legal obligations are summarized as follows:
</DIV>

</EFX_BALANCE_SHEET>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;(c)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 5.4PT" ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Market risk:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Market risk is the risk that changes in market prices, such as foreign currency exchange rates and interest rates, will affect the Company's income or the value of the financial instruments held.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	i
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 6PT" ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Foreign currency risk:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 54PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The majority of the Company's sales and purchases are made in U.S. dollars.&#160; However, certain of the Company's revenues and expenses are denominated in Canadian dollars.&#160; Foreign currency risk reflects the risk that the Company's earnings will be impacted by fluctuations in exchange rates.&#160; During the year ended December&#160;31, 2015, approximately 0.4% (2014 &#8211; 1.4%) of the Company's sales were made in Canadian dollars and approximately 14% (2014 - 35%) of expenses were incurred in Canadian dollars.&#160; With all other variables held constant, a 10% point increase in the value of the Canadian dollar relative to the U.S. dollar would have decreased net income by approximately $309,000 (2014 - $293,000) for the year ended December&#160;31, 2015.&#160; There would be an equal and opposite impact on the net income with a 10% point decrease in the value of the Canadian dollar relative to the U.S.&#160;dollar.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 54PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	At December&#160;31, 2015, the Company has Canadian dollar denominated working capital as well as a Canadian dollar denominated loan.&#160; Foreign exchange gains and losses arising from the revaluation of these balances are included in earnings.&#160; With all other variables held constant, a 10% point increase in the value of the Canadian dollar relative to the U.S. dollar would have decreased net income by approximately $1,454,000 (2014 - $2,561,000) for the year ended December&#160;31, 2015, based on the net working capital position and loan balances held in Canadian dollars.&#160; There would be an equal and opposite impact on the net income with a 10% point decrease in the value of the Canadian dollar relative to the U.S.&#160;dollar.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 54PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The objective of the Company's foreign exchange risk management activities is to minimize transaction exposures and the resulting volatility of the Company's earnings.&#160; The Company manages this risk by pricing sales in U.S. dollars or the currency of the expenses being incurred.&#160; The Company has not entered into any forward foreign exchange contracts as at December, 31 2015.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">

</DIV>

<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="3C396C195C0A466A9A68EE67F13E71E8" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	Interest rate risk:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 54PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company's policy is to invest cash and equivalents at floating rates of interest, in order to maintain liquidity, while achieving a satisfactory return for the Company.&#160; Fluctuations in interest rates impact the value of cash equivalents.&#160; The Company's interest bearing liabilities are fixed rate instruments, except for its Scotia Facility (note 12). Fluctuations in market interest rates will have no significant impact on the Company's fixed rate debt instruments, but may impact the fair value of such instruments at any given date.&#160; With respect to the Company's Scotia Facility, with all other variables held constant, a 10% point increase in the interest rate would have reduced net income by approximately $5,000 (2014 - $nil) for the year ended December&#160;31, 2015.&#160; There would be an equal and opposite impact on the net income with a 10% point decrease.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
