<EFX_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION>
<A NAME="FIS_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION"></A>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS FOR THE YEAR ENDED DECEMBER 31, 2015
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The following discussion and analysis should be read in conjunction with CRH Medical Corporation's (the "Company" or "CRH") audited annual financial statements for the years ended December 31, 2015 and 2014.&#160; The audited consolidated financial statements have been prepared in accordance with International Financial Reporting Standards ("IFRS"), as issued by the International Accounting Standards Board.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Unless otherwise specified, all financial data is presented in United States dollars. This management discussion and analysis is as of February 24, 2016.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Additional information related to the Company, including the Company's Annual Information Form is available on SEDAR at www.sedar.com.
</DIV>
</EFX_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION>
<EFX_FORWARD_LOOK>
<A NAME="FIS_FORWARD_LOOK_2"></A>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	CAUTION REGARDING&#160;FORWARD-LOOKING STATEMENTS
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Information included or incorporated by reference in this report may contain forward-looking statements.&#160; This information may involve known and unknown risks, uncertainties, and other factors which may cause our actual results, performance, or achievements to be materially different from the future results, performance, or achievements expressed or implied by any forward-looking statements.&#160; Forward-looking statements, which involve assumptions and describe our future plans, strategies, and expectations, are generally identifiable by use of the words "may," "will," "should," "expect," "anticipate," "estimate," "believe," "plan," "intend" or "project" or the negative of these words or other variations on these words or comparable terminology. Readers are cautioned regarding statements discussing profitability; growth strategies; anticipated trends in our industry; our future financing plans; and our anticipated needs for working capital. Forward looking statements in this report include statements regarding additional acquisitions, increasing revenue and operating EBITDA, continued growth of our business and leveraging our capabilities. Actual events or results may differ materially from those discussed in forward-looking statements.&#160; There can be no assurance that the forward-looking statements currently contained in this report will in fact occur. The Company bases its forward-looking statements on information currently available to it, and assumes no obligation to update them. The Company disclaims any intent or obligations to update or revise publicly any forward-looking statements whether as a result of new information, estimates or options, future events or results or otherwise, unless required to do so by law.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Forward-looking information reflects current expectations of management regarding future events and operating performance as of the date of this document. Such information involves significant risks and uncertainties, should not be read as guarantees of future performance or results, and will not necessarily be accurate indications of whether or not such results will be achieved. A number of factors could cause actual results to differ materially from the results discussed in forward-looking information, including, without limitation: our need for additional financing and our estimates regarding our capital requirements, future revenues and profitability; unfavourable economic conditions could have an adverse effect on our business; risks related to the Company's credit facilities; the policies of health insurance carriers may affect the amount of revenue the Company receives; our ability to successfully market and sell our products and services; our estimates of the size of the potential markets for our products and services; we may be subject to competition and technological risk which may impact the price and amount of product we can sell and nature of services we can provide; our ability to and the cost of compliance with extensive existing regulation and any changes or amendments thereto; changes within the medical industry and third-party reimbursement policies and our estimates of associated timing and costs with the same; changes in key United States federal or state laws, rules, and regulations; our ability to establish, maintain and defend intellectual property rights; risks related to U.S. antitrust regulations; risks related to record keeping and confidentiality by our affiliated physicians; our ability to recruit and retain qualified physicians and other service providers to provide our services; our ability to enforce non-competition covenants of any departed physicians and other service providers; risks related to corporate practice of medicine and our ability to renew and maintain agreements with anesthesiologists and other contractors; risks related to our ability to renegotiate, renew or replace services agreements under which we provide anesthesia services; risks related to changes in regulations that would necessitate adapting or re-negotiating our existing operating agreements; our ability and forecasts of expansion and the Company's management of anticipated growth; our senior management has been key to our growth and we may be adversely affected if we are unable to retain, conflicts of interest develop with or we lose any key member of our senior management; risks associated with manufacture of our products and our economic dependence on suppliers; changes in the industry and the economy may affect the Company's business; risks related to the competitive nature of the medical industry; evolving regulation of corporate governance and public disclosure may result in additional corporate expenses; adverse events relating to our product or services could result in risks relating to product liability, medical malpractice, other legal claims, insurance, product recalls and other liabilities; risks associated with use of our products in unapproved circumstances; various risks associated with legal, regulatory or investigative proceedings; health and safety risks are intrinsic within our industry; our ability to successfully identify, evaluate and complete future transactions; anti-takeover provisions create risks related to lost opportunities; we may not continue to attract gastroenterologists and other licensed providers to purchase and use the CRH O'Regan System or to provide our services; risks associated with the trading of our common shares on a public marketplace; risks related to adverse movements in foreign currency exchange rates; and risks related to maintaining our foreign private issuer status.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
	1
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage107"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	OVERVIEW
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	CRH Medical Corporation is a North American company focused on providing physicians with innovative products and services for the treatment of gastrointestinal diseases. The Company's product distribution strategy focuses on physician education, patient outcomes, and patient awareness. The Company's first product, the CRH O'Regan System, is a single use, disposable, hemorrhoid banding technology that is safe and highly effective in treating hemorrhoid grades I &#8211; IV.&#160; CRH distributes the CRH O'Regan System, treatment protocols, operational and marketing expertise as a complete, turnkey package directly to physicians, allowing CRH to create meaningful relationships with the physicians it serves. In 2014, CRH acquired a full service gastroenterology anesthesia company, Gastroenterology Anesthesia Associates, LLC ("GAA"), which provides anesthesia services for patients undergoing endoscopic procedures and has complemented this acquisition with further acquisitions of anesthesia providers completed during the first, third and fourth quarters of 2015. Anesthesia assisted endoscopies make these procedures more comfortable for patients and allows gastroenterologists to perform more procedures. CRH plans to leverage the capabilities it acquired through GAA to consolidate the highly fragmented gastroenterology anesthesia provider business.&#160;The Company's goal is to establish CRH as the premier provider of innovative products and essential services to gastroenterologists throughout the United States.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
	2
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage108"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company has financed its cash requirements primarily from revenues generated from the sale of its product directly to physicians, anesthesia sales, equity financings, debt financings and a revolving credit facility.&#160; The Company's ability to maintain the carrying value of its assets is dependent on successfully marketing its products and services and maintaining future profitable operations, the outcome of which cannot be predicted at this time.&#160; The Company has also stated its intention to acquire or develop additional anesthesia businesses. It may be necessary for the Company to raise additional funds for the continuing development of its business plan, including additional acquisitions.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	For further information about CRH Medical Corporation, including the Company's Annual Information Form, please visit the Company website at
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	www.crhmedcorp.com
</FONT>
	or
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	www.sedar.com
</FONT>
	, or email us at
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	info@crhmedcorp.com
</FONT>
	.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	RECENT EVENTS
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	John's Creek Anesthesia Associates LLC ("John's Creek") &#8211; December 2015
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In December 2015, a subsidiary of the Company entered into an asset purchase agreement to purchase certain assets of John's Creek Anesthesia, LLC ("John's Creek"), an anesthesia services provider in the Southeastern United States.&#160; The total purchase price under the asset purchase agreement was $1,200,000 and was paid via cash.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Macon Gastroenterology Anesthesia Associates LLC ("MGAA") &#8211; December 2015
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In December 2015, a subsidiary of the Company entered into an asset contribution and exchange agreement to acquire 65% of the ownership interest in Macon Gastroenterology Anesthesia Associates LLC ("MGAA"), an anesthesia services provider in the Southeastern United States.&#160; The total purchase price under the asset contribution and exchange agreement was $4,670,000 and was paid via cash.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	US Listing &#8211; September 2015
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In September 2015, the Company's common shares were approved for listing on the NYSE MKT, LLC (the "NYSE MKT") subject to continued satisfaction of listing requirements. The Company's common shares began trading on the NYSE MKT under the ticker "CRHM" on September 3, 2015. The Company's common stock is dual listed and will continue to trade on the TSX under its existing symbol "CRH."
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Knoxville Gastroenterology Anesthesia Associates LLC ("KGAA") &#8211; September 2015
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In September 2015, a subsidiary of the Company entered into an asset contribution and exchange agreement to acquire 51% of the ownership interest in Knoxville Gastroenterology Anesthesia Associates LLC ("KGAA"), an anesthesia services provider in the Southeastern United States.&#160; The total purchase price under the asset contribution and exchange agreement was $6,818,352 and was paid via a combination of cash and common shares.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Associates in Digestive Health LLC ("ADH") &#8211; August 2015
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In August 2015, a subsidiary of the Company entered into an asset purchase agreement to purchase certain assets of Associates in Digestive Health LLC ("ADH"), an anesthesia services provider in the Southeastern United States.&#160; The total purchase price under the asset purchase agreement was $6,600,000 and was paid via cash.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
	3
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage109"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Bought Deal Equity Offering &#8211; March 2015
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	On March 25, 2015, the Company closed a bought deal equity offering and over-allotment option of 7,000,000 and 1,050,000 common shares, respectively, at a price of $2.72 (CAD$3.40) per common share for gross proceeds of $21,865,893 (CAD$27,370,000). In connection with the offering, the underwriters were paid a 6% commission totaling approximately $1,311,954 (CAD$1,642,200).&#160; The Company also issued 241,500 Broker Warrants with a total value of $249,149 to the underwriters and incurred additional share issuance costs of $299,230 (CAD$375,059) in relation to the offering.&#160; As of December 31, 2015, 140,795 of the Broker Warrants were exercised.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The proceeds of the offering were used in part to reduce corporate indebtedness and the balance will be used to fund future acquisitions, as well as for working capital and general corporate purposes.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
	4
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage110"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	NON-IFRS FINANCIAL MEASURES
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In addition to results reported in accordance with IFRS, the Company uses certain non-IFRS financial measures as supplemental indicators of its financial and operating performance. These non-IFRS financial measures include Operating EBITDA and Operating expenses &#8211; adjusted. The Company believes these supplementary financial measures reflect the Company's ongoing business in a manner that allows for meaningful period-to-period comparisons and analysis of trends in its business.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company defines Operating EBITDA as operating earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and related expenses, amortization, stock based compensation, acquisition related expenses and asset impairment charges. Operating EBITDA
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 6.5PT">
	&#160;
</SUP>
	is presented on a basis consistent with the Company's internal management reports. The Company discloses Operating EBITDA to capture the profitability of its business before the impact of items not considered in management's evaluation of operating unit performance.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company defines Operating expenses &#8211; adjusted as operating expenses before expenses related to acquisitions, stock based compensation, depreciation and related expenses, amortization and asset impairment charges.&#160; Operating expenses &#8211; adjusted is presented on a basis consistent with the Company's internal management reports.&#160; The Company discloses Operating expenses &#8211; adjusted to capture the non-operational expenses of the business before the impact of items not considered by management to impact operating decisions.&#160; The Company also discloses Operating expenses &#8211; adjusted by segment.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Operating EBITDA and Operating expenses &#8211; adjusted do not have any standardized meaning prescribed by IFRS and therefore may not be comparable to similar measures presented by other companies. The Company cautions readers to consider these non-IFRS financial measures in addition to, and not as an alternative for, measures calculated in accordance with IFRS.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: -7.1PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 7.1PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: -7.1PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 7.1PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage112"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	RESULTS OF OPERATIONS &#8211; year ended December 31, 2015
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Except where otherwise indicated, all financial information discussed below is 100% of the consolidated results of the Company and includes both the Company's interest in subsidiaries, as well as the interest of persons holding non-controlling interests in non-wholly owned subsidiaries of the Company.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Revenue
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Revenues for the year ended December 31, 2015 were $46,048,480 compared to $11,984,170 for the year ended December 31, 2014. The increase in revenues is mainly attributable to the Company's anesthesia service acquisitions completed throughout 2015 and in the fourth quarter of 2014, with incremental revenue contributions from these acquisitions of $33,109,962 during the year ended December 31, 2015.&#160; This increase is in addition to the increase in product sales of $954,348 during the year ended December 31, 2015.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Anesthesia Services Revenue
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Revenues from
</FONT>
	anesthesia services for the year ended December 31, 2015 were $36,496,035.&#160; The Company's first anesthesia acquisition was in the fourth quarter of 2014, with additional acquisitions in the first, third and fourth quarters of 2015.&#160; As a result, fiscal 2015 is not comparable to fiscal 2014.&#160; The new transactions in the first, third and fourth quarters of 2015 contributed revenue of $4,678,558.&#160; During the year, the anesthesia services segment serviced 71,447 patient cases.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The revenue contribution in the year from the Company's acquisition of GAA in December 2014, was $31,315,824.&#160;&#160; At December 31, 2014, the Company estimated 2014 pro forma revenues from the GAA acquisition of $34,520,315.&#160; The pro-forma revenues were estimated based on the best available information at the time and included estimates involving bad debt as well as net realizable revenue by payor.&#160; In normalizing this revenue, management has updated the 2014 pro forma estimates to reflect actual bad debt expense, revenue by payor and to also reflect significant rate changes effective prior to the acquisition.&#160; Normalized for these factors, the 2014 pro forma estimate of GAA revenues is $30,047,516 compared to GAA revenue of $31,315,824 for the year ended December 31, 2015.&#160; The normalization of 2014 revenues has had no impact on management's estimate of the GAA earn-out liability recorded on the balance sheet at December 31, 2015.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The table below summarizes our approximate payor mix as a percentage of service volume for fiscal 2015.
</DIV>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_48"></A>

<TR>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2PX SOLID; BORDER-LEFT: #000000 2PX SOLID; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF; WIDTH: 73%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BORDER-TOP: #000000 2PX SOLID; BORDER-RIGHT: #000000 2PX SOLID">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Payor
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2PX SOLID; BORDER-LEFT: #000000 2PX SOLID; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF; WIDTH: 27%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; BORDER-TOP: #000000 2PX SOLID; BORDER-RIGHT: #000000 2PX SOLID">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Year ended December 31, 2015
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In the future, the Company expects anesthesia services revenue to continue to increase primarily through acquisitions and to increase via organic growth.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Product Sales Revenue
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Revenues from product sales for the year ended December 31, 2015 were $9,552,445 compared to $8,598,097 for the year ended December 31, 2014. The 11% increase in product sales is the result of the continuing successful execution of the Company's direct to physician program that provides physicians the ability to purchase our hemorrhoid banding technology, treatment protocols, marketing and operational experience.&#160; As of December 31, 2015 the Company has trained 2,175 physicians to use the O'Regan System, representing 811 clinical practices. This compares to 1,916 physicians trained, representing 701 clinical practices, as of December 31, 2015.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
	7
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage113"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In the future, the Company expects revenue from product sales to continue to increase as we expand our physician network and increase physician use of our technology.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Total operating expenses - adjusted
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	For the year ended December 31, 2015,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	total adjusted operating expenses
</FONT>
	were $22,016,845
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	compared to $7,288,076 for 2014.&#160; The $14,728,769 increase is primarily related to adjusted operating expenses for anesthesia services as the prior year only contains one month of anesthesia activity for the GAA acquisition acquired in December 2014.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Anesthesia services adjusted operating expenses for the year ended December 31, 2015 were $15,528,409
</FONT>
	.&#160; Anesthesia services expenses primarily include labor related cost for the certified registered nurse anesthetists, the medical director, medical drugs and supplies, and billing and management related expenses.&#160; The Company's first anesthesia acquisition was in the fourth quarter of 2014, with further acquisitions completed in the first, third and fourth quarters of 2015.&#160; As a result, 2015 is not comparable to 2014.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Product sales adjusted operating expenses for the year ended December 31, 2015 were $3,723,633
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	compared to $3,868,830
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	for 2014.&#160; The slight decrease in expenses compared to 2014 is a reflection of cost savings associated with reduced professional fees and lowered employee related expenses as a result of the decline in the Canadian dollar, offset by the additional product cost and support associated with a 11% increase in product sales.&#160; P
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	roduct sales expenses primarily include employee wages, product cost and support, marketing programs, office expenses,
</FONT>
	professional fees, and insurance.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Corporate adjusted operating expenses for the year ended December 31, 2015 were $2,764,803 compared to $2,164,053 for 2014.&#160; This reflects a growth in expenses in 2015 of $600,750.&#160; The growth in corporate expenses is primarily the result of an increase in professional fees, travel and entertainment costs, and insurance and, in general, is reflective of the additional activities incurred in support of the Company's expanded service offering and investor base.&#160; Contributing to the increase in professional fees are additional professional fees incurred in relation to the Company's listing on the NYSE of $244,138 during the year.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Operating EBITDA
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Operating EBITDA attributable to shareholders of the Company for the year ended December 31, 2015 was $23,424,346, an increase of $18,728,251 from 2014.&#160; The increase in Operating EBITDA is primarily a reflection of the Company's newly acquired anesthesia service providers offset by a net increase in product and corporate operating expenses.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Operating EBITDA attributable to non-controlling interest was $607,289 for the year ended December 31, 2015.&#160; This comprises the non-controlling interests' share of revenues of $1,118,103 and adjusted operating expenses of $510,814.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Total operating EBITDA was $24,031,635 for the year ended December 31, 2015, an increase of $19,335,541 from the prior year.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
	8
</DIV>

<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage114"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Operating Income
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Operating income for the year ended December 31, 2015 was $13,431,186
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	compared to $
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2,977,893
</FONT>
	for 2014, an increase of $10,453,293.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Contributing to the improved operating income during the year is the increase in total Operating EBITDA of $19,335,541, less incremental costs related to the amortization of acquired professional service agreements of $6,336,958, an increase in stock based compensation expense of $2,387,213, asset impairment and write-offs in the period totaling $630,639, offset by a reduction in acquisition expenses of $484,369.&#160; During the quarter ended September 30, 2015, the Company recorded an impairment charge of $389,693 in relation to the AHP acquisition as a result of the closure of one of the endoscopy centers to which the Company provided anesthesia services under a professional services agreement.&#160; In addition, the Company wrote-off certain inventories totaling $240,946 during the same quarter.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Anesthesia operating income for the year was $13,392,542, an increase of $11,719,731 from the preceding year.&#160; The increase is reflective of the addition of the Company's anesthesia acquisitions in the fourth quarter of 2014 along with the further acquisitions completed in the first, third and fourth quarters of 2015.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Product operating income for the year was $5,183,301, an increase of $556,134 from the prior year.&#160; The increase is a result of the increased revenue in the year of $954,348, offset by additional expenses relating to the write-off of inventories in the year as well as an increase in stock base compensation expense when compared to the prior year.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The GAA acquisition in December 2014
</FONT>
	was financed by cash on hand along with senior and subordinated credit facilities from Knight Therapeutics Inc. and affiliates of Crown Capital Partners Inc., in the amounts of $30,000,000 and CAD$22,500,000 (USD$19,863,000) respectively, as well as a loan from The Bloom Burton Healthcare Structured Lending Fund II and a private placement of the Company's common shares.&#160;&#160; In November 2015, certain of the debt (the Knight Note and Bloom Burton Facility) was refinanced via a revolving credit facility in the amount of $33,000,000 with the Bank of Nova Scotia (the Scotia Facility).
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	As a result of the Company's debt facilities, the Company has recorded net finance expense of $13,084,328 during the year, compared to net finance expense of $1,623,459 in 2014.&#160; Net finance expense is comprised of both interest and other debt related expenses, as well as foreign exchange gains and losses on the Crown debt which is denominated in Canadian dollars.&#160; In the year ended December 31, 2015, the Company recorded an exchange gain of $2,737,964 in relation to the Crown note.&#160; Excluding the impact of the exchange gain in the year, the finance expense for the year was $15,822,292. Finance expense, excluding fair value adjustments and exchange gains, was $10,090,998.&#160; The fair value adjustments recorded in the year resulted from changes in estimates underlying the Knight facility and the Company's earn-out obligation. For the year ended December 31, 2015, finance expense also includes expenses relating to the extinguishment of the Knight Note and the Bloom Burton facilities, totaling $1,817,509.&#160; For further information, refer to the Financial Instruments section of this document.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Cash interest paid in the year ended December 31, 2015 was $5,903,690.&#160; This includes the payment of interest owing on the Knight Note and Bloom Burton facility at time of extinguishment.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Income tax recovery
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	For the year ended December 31, 2015, the Company recorded an income tax recovery of $2,912,970 compared to an income tax recovery of $143,719 for 2014. The recovery is a reflection of the recognition and utilization of previously unrecognized brought forward losses in the US as a result of the income generated by the Company's anesthesia services segment.&#160; The Company estimates that it will fully utilize its brought forward tax losses in early 2016.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Net and comprehensive income
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	For the year ended December 31, 2015, the Company recorded net and comprehensive income attributable to shareholders of the Company of $3,076,191 compared to a net and comprehensive income attributable to shareholders of $1,498,153 for fiscal 2014.&#160; The increase in earnings compared to 2014 is reflective of anesthesia services' contribution to earnings during the quarter, offset by increases in finance expense and stock based compensation in conjunction with impairment charges and acquisition expenses in the period.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Net and comprehensive income attributable to non-controlling interest was $183,637 for the year ended December 31, 2015.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	RESULTS OF OPERATIONS &#8211; three months ended December 31, 2015
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Except where otherwise indicated, all financial information discussed below is 100% of the consolidated results of the Company and includes both the Company's interest in subsidiaries, as well as the interest of persons holding non-controlling interests in non-wholly owned subsidiaries of the Company.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Revenue
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Revenues for the quarter ended December 31, 2015 were $13,937,531 compared to $5,746,388 for the three months ended December 31, 2014. The increase in revenues is mainly attributable to the Company's anesthesia service acquisitions completed throughout 2015 and in the fourth quarter of 2014, with total incremental revenue contributions from these acquisitions of $7,943,626 in the quarter.&#160; This increase is in addition to the increase in product sales of $247,517 during the fourth quarter of 2015.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The fourth quarter of the year is traditionally the highest revenue generating quarter of the year due to the impact of seasonality.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Anesthesia Services Revenue
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Revenues from anesthesia services for the quarter ended December 31, 2015 were $11,329,699.&#160; The Company's first anesthesia acquisition was in December 2014, with additional acquisitions in the first, third and fourth quarters of 2015.&#160; As a result, the fourth quarter of 2015 is not comparable to the fourth quarter of 2014.&#160; During the quarter, the anesthesia services segment serviced 24,924 patient
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	cases.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Anesthesia services revenue increased by $2,134,336 from the third quarter of 2015.&#160; This is predominantly due to the impact of acquisitions completed in the third quarter of 2015 but is also a reflection of seasonality experienced in the fourth quarter of the year.&#160; The fourth quarter of 2015 represents 26.4% of the anesthesia revenue for the year.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Product Sales Revenue
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Revenues from product
</FONT>
	sales for the quarter ended December 31, 2015 were $2,607,832 compared to $2,360,315 for the quarter ended December 31, 2014. The 10% increase in product sales is the result of the continuing successful execution of the Company's direct to physician program that provides physicians the ability to purchase our hemorrhoid banding technology, treatment protocols, marketing and operational experience and seasonality.&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	As of December 31, 2015 the Company has trained 2,175 physicians to use the O'Regan System, representing 811 clinical practices.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Total operating expenses - adjusted
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	For the quarter ended December 31, 2015,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	total adjusted operating expenses
</FONT>
	were $6,674,324
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	compared to $3,076,440 for the fourth quarter of 2014.&#160; The $3,597,884 increase is primarily related to adjusted operating expenses for anesthesia services as the prior year's fourth quarter only contains one month of anesthesia activity for the GAA acquisition acquired in December 2014.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Anesthesia services adjusted operating expenses for the quarter ended December 31, 2015 were $5,061,037
</FONT>
	. Anesthesia services expenses primarily include labor related cost for the certified registered nurse anesthetists, the medical director, medical drugs and supplies, and billing and management related expenses.&#160; The Company's first anesthesia acquisition was in December 2014, with further acquisitions completed in the first, third and fourth quarters of 2015.&#160; As a result, 2015 is not comparable to 2014.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
	11
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage117"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Product sales adjusted operating expenses for the quarter ended December 31, 2015 were $949,743
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	compared to $977,787
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	for 2014.&#160; The slight decrease in expenses compared to 2014 is a reflection of cost savings associated with reduced professional fees and the impact of the foreign exchange rates on costs incurred in Canadian dollars.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Corporate adjusted operating expenses for the quarter ended December 31, 2015 were $663,544 compared to $843,460 for 2014.&#160; This decrease in expenses is reflective of a decrease in employee related costs and professional fees when compared to the fourth quarter of 2014.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Operating EBITDA
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Operating EBITDA attributable to shareholders of the Company for the quarter ended December 31, 2015 was $6,797,393, an increase of $4,127,445 from 2014.&#160; The increase in Operating EBITDA is primarily a reflection of the Company's newly acquired anesthesia service providers and decreases product and corporate operating expenses in the quarter.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Operating EBITDA attributable to non-controlling interest was $465,814 for the quarter ended December 31, 2015.&#160; This comprises the non-controlling interests' share of revenues of $899,162 and adjusted operating expenses of $433,348.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Total operating EBITDA was $7,263,207 for the quarter ended December 31, 2015, an increase of $4,593,259 from the fourth quarter of 2014.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Operating Income
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Operating income for the quarter ended December 31, 2015 was $4,672,629
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	compared to $
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	1,284,626
</FONT>
	for the fourth quarter of 2014, an increase of $3,388,003.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Contributing to the improved operating income during the quarter is the increase in total Operating EBITDA of $4,593,260, less additional costs related to the amortization of acquired professional service agreements of $1,730,312, an increase in stock based compensation expense of $191,131, offset by a reduction in acquisition expenses of $721,905.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Anesthesia operating income for the quarter was $3,940,943, an increase of $2,268,132 from the fourth quarter of 2014.&#160;&#160; This is reflective of the Company's first anesthesia acquisition in December 2014 along with additional acquisitions in the first, third and fourth quarters of 2015.&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Product operating income for the quarter was $1,576,450, an increase of $216,479 from the fourth quarter of 2014.&#160; The increase is a result of the increased revenue in the quarter of $247,517, offset by a slight increase in product expenses relating to stock based compensation.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	As a result of the Company's debt facilities, the Company has recorded net finance expense of $5,914,145 during the quarter, compared to net finance expense of $1,623,459 in the fourth quarter of 2014.&#160; Net finance expense is comprised of both interest and other debt related expenses, as well as foreign exchange gains and losses on the Crown debt which is denominated in Canadian dollars.&#160; In the quarter ended December 31, 2015, the Company recorded an exchange gain of $543,122 in relation to the Crown note, comparable to the exchange gain of $410,208 recorded in the fourth quarter of 2014.&#160; Excluding the impact of the exchange gain in the quarter, the finance expense for the quarter was $6,457,267. Finance expense, excluding fair value adjustments and exchange gains, was $3,519,069.&#160; The fair value adjustments recorded in the year resulted from changes in estimates underlying the Knight facility and the Company's earn-out obligation. For the quarter ended December 31, 2015, finance expense also includes expenses relating to the extinguishment of the Knight Note and the Bloom Burton facilities, totaling $1,817,509.&#160; For further information, refer to the Financial Instruments section of this document.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
	12
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage118"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Cash interest paid in the quarter ended December 31, 2015 was $1,122,165.&#160; This includes the payment of interest owing on the Knight Note and Bloom Burton facility at the time of extinguishment.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Income tax recovery
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	For the quarter ended December 31, 2015, the Company recorded an income tax recovery of $1,540,757 compared to an income tax recovery of $721,497 for the fourth quarter of 2014.&#160; The recovery is a reflection of the recognition and utilization of previously unrecognized brought forward losses in the US as a result of the income generated by the Company's anesthesia services segment.&#160; The Company estimates that it will fully utilize its brought forward tax losses in early 2016.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Net and comprehensive income
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	For the quarter ended December 31, 2015, the Company recorded net and comprehensive income attributable to shareholders of the Company of $154,078 compared to a net and comprehensive income attributable to shareholders of $382,664 for the fourth quarter of 2014.&#160; The decrease in earnings compared to 2014 is reflective of increases in finance expense in the quarter, offset by anesthesia services' contribution to earnings during the quarter.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Net and comprehensive income attributable to non-controlling interest was $145,165 for the fourth quarter of 2015.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	RESULTS OF OPERATIONS &#8211; comparison to the immediately preceding quarter
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Revenues have increased by $2,327,656 compared to the immediately preceding quarter.&#160; This is reflective of both new anesthesia acquisitions completed in the fourth quarter, the impact of acquisitions completed in the third quarter, as well as seasonality inherent in both the anesthesia and product businesses.&#160; Traditionally, the fourth quarter is the highest revenue generating quarter of the year due to the impact of seasonality.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Total adjusted operating expenses have increased by $964,398.&#160; This increase is mainly a result of increases in Anesthesia services adjusted operating expenses from the new acquisitions completed at the tail end of the third quarter and completed during the fourth quarter.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	As a result of the above, operating EBITDA has increased by $1,363,258 when compared to the immediately preceding quarter.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Net and comprehensive income has decreased by $1,414,993 compared to the immediately preceding quarter.&#160; This is a reflection of the additional finance expenses incurred in the fourth quarter of 2015, offset by additional tax recoveries.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
	13
</DIV>

<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF; WIDTH: 7%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 9.1PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: -7.1PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 7.1PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 4.5PT">
	3
</SUP>
	&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 7PT">
	Anesthesia revenue in Q4 2014 represents 1 month of anesthesia activity. Anesthesia revenues are calculated assuming an allowance for doubtful accounts estimate of 10%.&#160; The allowance for doubtful accounts estimate has been revised to 6% in 2015.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 8PT; TEXT-INDENT: -7.1PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 7.1PT; FONT-SIZE: 7PT">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 4.5PT">
	2
</SUP>
	&#160; Operating expenses - adjusted:&#160; This is a non-IFRS measure defined as operating expenses before acquisition related expenses, stock based compensation, depreciation and related expenses, amortization and asset impairment charges.&#160; Refer to the end of this document for the reconciliation of reported financial results to non-IFRS measures.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 9.1PT; TEXT-INDENT: -7.1PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 7.1PT; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER;FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 5PT">
	3
</SUP>
	&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 7PT">
	Operating EBITDA:&#160; This is a non-IFRS measure defined as operating earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and related expenses, amortization, stock based compensation, acquisition related corporate expenses and asset impairment charges. Refer to the end of this document for the reconciliation of reporting financial results to non-IFRS measures.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 8PT; TEXT-INDENT: -7.1PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 7.1PT; FONT-SIZE: 7PT">
	4 Non-controlling interest reflects the ownership interest of persons holding non-controlling interests in non-wholly owned subsidiaries of the Company.

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
	14
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage120"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	LIQUIDITY AND CAPITAL RESOURCES
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	As at December 31, 2015, the Company had $3,572,344 in cash and cash equivalents compared to $4,133,663 at the end of 2014.&#160; The decrease in cash and equivalents is primarily a reflection of the bought deal equity offering that the Company completed on March 25, 2015, in combination with cash generated from operations, offset by utilization of cash to complete acquisitions in the year and the Company's repayment of principal on its Scotia Facility.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Working capital was $3,272,075 compared to negative working capital of $2,577,963 at December 31, 2014.&#160; The Company expects to meet its short-term obligations through cash earned through operating activities.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company has financed its operations primarily from revenues generated from product and anesthesia services and through equity and debt financings. As of December 31, 2015, the Company has raised approximately $51 million from the sale and issuance of equity securities.&#160; The Company also obtained debt financing of $52 million via senior and subordinated credit facilities with Crown, Bloom Burton and Knight in 2014 and entered into a revolving credit facility with the Bank of Nova Scotia for $33,000,000. There have been no changes in the Crown note since December 31, 2014; however, in conjunction with the Company's bought deal equity offering and via the Scotia Facility, the Company has extinguished its financial obligations in respect of the Bloom Burton facility and the Knight Note.&#160;&#160; The Company's credit facilities are described as follows:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Norrep Credit Opportunities Fund II, LP ("Crown Note")
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	On December 1, 2014, the Company entered into an agreement to borrow funds in the form of a subordinated note payable from Norrep Credit Opportunities Fund II, LP.&#160; At inception, the original amount of the note payable was CAD$22,500,000 (USD$19,863,000).&#160; The note bears interest at 12% per annum with a decrease to 10% upon repayment and performance in full of the Company's obligations under its senior credit agreement (see Scotia Facility).&#160; Interest on the note is payable on a quarterly basis beginning March 31, 2015, with the payment of the principal scheduled for June 1, 2018, but prepayment without penalty is available to the Company as of December 1, 2017.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Bank of Nova Scotia ("Scotia Facility")
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	On November 24, 2015, the Company entered into a credit facility with the Bank of Nova Scotia.&#160; The facility, which has a maturity date of April 30, 2018, provides financing of up to $33,000,000.&#160; As at December 31, 2015, the Company had drawn $17,000,000 on the facility.&#160; The facility is repayable in full at maturity, with scheduled principal repayments on a quarterly basis beginning March 31, 2016 based upon the outstanding balance of the credit facility.&#160; The facility is a revolving credit facility which the Company may terminate at any time without penalty.&#160; The credit facility bears interest at a floating rate based on the US prime rate, LIBOR or bankers' acceptance rates plus an applicable margin.&#160; At December 31, 2015, the interest rate on the facility was LIBOR plus 2.75%.&#160; Commitment fees, legal fees directly related to the credit facility, and standby charges usual for borrowings of this nature were and are payable.&#160; The Scotia Facility replaced the Knight Note as the Company's senior debt agreement on extinguishment of the Note.&#160; The Facility is secured by the assets of the Company.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company is required to maintain the following financial covenants in respect of the facility:
</DIV>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage121"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	As at December 31, 2015, the Company is in compliance with all debt covenants relating to the Crown Note and Scotia Facility
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	.&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Although the Company recorded net earnings for the years ended December 31, 2015 and 2014, the Company has incurred historical losses, and as at December 31, 2015 had an accumulated deficit of $9,831,078. The Company expects that going forward cash from operating activities will be positive and will be sufficient to fund the current business.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Cash provided by operating activities for the year ended December 31, 2015 was $17,957,340 compared to $1,388,110 for fiscal
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2014.&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company's near-term cash requirements relate primarily to interest payments, quarterly principal payments in respect of the Scotia facility, operations, working capital and general corporate purposes, including acquisitions. Based on the current business plan, the Company believes cash and cash equivalents and the availability of its revolving credit facility will be sufficient to fund the Company's operating, debt repayment and capital requirements for at least the next 12 months.&#160; The Company updates its forecasts on a regular basis and will consider additional financing sources as appropriate.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The following table summarizes the relative maturities of the financial liabilities of the Company:
</DIV>

	As at December 31, 2015, the Company has no material contractual obligations, other than those obligations relating to its leases of premises and those obligations under its debt agreements, as described above.&#160; The minimum lease payments in respect of the Company's leases will be $119,043 in fiscal 2016.

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	OUTSTANDING SHARE CAPITAL
</DIV>

	As at December 31, 2015 there were 71,206,547 common shares issued and outstanding for a total of $51,066,044 in share capital.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	As at December 31, 2015 there were 2,974,311 options outstanding at a weighted-average exercise price of $0.43 per share, of which 2,111,186 were exercisable into common shares at a weighted-average exercise price of $0.42 per share.&#160; As at December 31, 2015, there were 1,509,000 share units issued and outstanding.
</DIV>

	As at February 24, 2016 there are 71,262,797 common shares issued and outstanding for a total of $51,135,131 in share capital. There are 2,918,061 options outstanding at a weighted-average exercise price of $0.44 per share, of which 2,126,811 were exercisable into common shares at a weighted average price of $0.43 per share.&#160; As at February 24, 2016, there are 1,494,000 share units issued and outstanding.

<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2PX SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF; WIDTH: 9%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM" VALIGN="BOTTOM">

	3,283,884
</DIV>
</TD>
