<EFX_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES>
<A NAME="FIS_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES_2"></A>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	DISCLOSURE CONTROLS AND PROCEDURES (DCP) AND INTERNAL CONTROLS OVER FINANCIAL REPORTING (ICFR)
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Disclosure controls and procedures are designed to provide reasonable assurance that material information required to be disclosed in the prescribed filings and reports filed with the Canadian securities regulatory authorities is recorded, processed, summarized and reported on a timely basis. Controls are also designed to provide reasonable assurance that information required to be disclosed is assimilated and communicated to senior management in a timely manner so that appropriate decisions can be made regarding public disclosure. The Company's Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer have evaluated the effectiveness of the Company's disclosure controls and procedures and concluded that they provide reasonable assurance that material information relating to the Company was made known to them and reported as required.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
	17
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage123"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	INTERNAL CONTROLS OVER FINANCIAL REPORTING
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Management has designed internal controls over financial reporting (ICFR) to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of the Company's financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements in accordance with International Financial Reporting Standards. Management, including the Company's Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer, is responsible for establishing and maintaining adequate ICFR, which has been developed based on the framework established in Internal Control &#8211; Integrated Framework issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission (COSO (2013)).
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company's Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer, conducted an evaluation of the effectiveness of the Company's internal control over financial reporting based on the COSO (2013) framework and concluded that the Company's internal control over financial reporting was effective as of December 31, 2015.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Regardless of how well an internal control system is designed and operated, it can provide only reasonable, not absolute, assurance that all misstatements due to error or fraud will be detected or prevented from occurring in the financial statements due to the inherent limitations of any internal control system.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	During 2015 there were no significant changes in the Company's internal controls over financial reporting that have materially affected or are reasonably likely to affect the Company's internal controls over financial reporting.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	CRITICAL ACCOUNTING ESTIMATES
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Estimates and underlying assumptions are reviewed on an ongoing basis.&#160; Revisions to accounting estimates are recognized in the period in which the estimates are revised and in any future periods affected.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Significant areas requiring the use of management estimates relate to the assessment for impairment and useful lives of intangible assets, determining the fair value of share units, estimates supporting reported anesthesia revenues, the recoverability of trade receivables, the valuation of certain long term liabilities and other assets, including liabilities relating to contingent consideration, the vesting term for share units with market based performance targets, the valuation of acquired intangibles, the valuation of deferred tax assets and the allocation of purchase consideration to the fair value of assets acquired and liabilities assumed.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Significant judgments made by management in the process of applying accounting policies and that have the most significant effect on the amounts recognized in the consolidated financial statements includes the determination of functional currency and the accounting classification of financial instruments.&#160;&#160; In conjunction with the Company's business acquisitions, these judgments also include the Company's determination of control for the purposes of consolidation and the Company's definition of a business.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	We consider the estimates and assumptions described in this section to be an important part in understanding the financial statements. These estimates and assumptions are subject to change, as they rely heaving on management's judgment and are based on factors that are inherently uncertain.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
	18
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage124"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;(a)&#160; Impairment and useful lives of long-lived assets
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company's intangible assets are comprised of purchased technology, purchased professional service agreements, and patents. The cost of the Company's intangible assets is amortized on a straight-line basis over the estimated useful life ranging from 0.7 to 20 years. Factors considered in estimating the useful life of intangible assets include the expected use of the asset by the Company, legal, regulatory and contractual provisions that may limit the useful life, and the effects of competition. Costs incurred to establish and maintain patents for intellectual property developed internally are expensed in the period incurred.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The carrying amounts of the Company's intangible assets are reviewed at each balance sheet date to determine whether there is any indication of impairment as required by IAS 36.&#160; If any such indication exists, the asset's recoverable amount is estimated.&#160; An impairment loss is recognized whenever the carrying amount of the intangible assets or their cash-generating unit exceeds their recoverable amount. Impairment losses are recognized in the statements of operations.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The recoverable amount of an asset or cash-generating unit is the greater of its value in use and its fair value less costs to sell.&#160; In assessing value in use, the estimated future cash flows are discounted to their present value using a discount rate that reflects current market assessments of the time value of money and the risks specific to the asset.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In accordance with IFRS if, subsequent to impairment, an asset's discounted future net cash flows exceeds its book value, the impairment previously recognized can be reversed. However, the asset's book value cannot exceed what its amortized book value would have been had the impairment not been recognized.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	During the year ended December 31, 2015, the Company recorded an impairment charge of $389,693 in relation to the AHP acquisition as a result of the closure of one of the endoscopy centers to which the Company provided anesthesia services under a professional services agreement.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="2C8F0338B0004633AD7481F6EE9381FA" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	Revenue recognition &#8211; Anesthesia services:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Anesthesia services revenue consists primarily of patient revenues and is recognized as services are rendered. Patient service revenue is reported net of provisions for contractual allowances and other discounts from third party payers and patients. The Company has agreements with third-party payers that provide for payments to the Company at amounts different from its established billing rates. The differences between the estimated program reimbursement rates and the standard billing rates are accounted for as contractual adjustments, which are deducted from gross revenues to arrive at net operating revenues. Retroactive adjustments, if any, are accrued on an estimated basis in the period the related services are rendered and adjusted in future periods as final settlements are determined. Accounts receivable resulting from such payment arrangements are recorded net of contractual allowances.&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The provision for contractual allowances and discounts are recognized on an accrual basis. These amounts are deducted from gross service revenue to determine net service revenue.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
	19
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage125"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="BAD040B22AFA45EFB413682980D54AEC" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	(c)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	Accounts receivable and allowance for doubtful accounts:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company's accounts receivable are related to providing healthcare services to patients and the sale of product directly to physicians. Collection of these accounts receivable is the Company's primary source of cash and is critical to its operating performance. The Company's primary collection risks relate to patient deductibles, co-payments and self-insured amounts owed by the patient. The Company's estimate for the allowance for doubtful accounts is calculated based on historical experiences and collection experience. The Company believes that it collects substantially all of its receivables related to providing healthcare to patients, net of contractual allowances and from the sale of product directly to physicians. To date, the Company believes there has not been a material difference between bad debt allowances and the ultimate historical collection rates on accounts receivables. The Company reviews its overall bad debts reserve for adequacy by monitoring historical cash collections as a percentage of net revenue. Uncollected accounts are written off when management determines that the balance is uncollectible.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;(d)&#160; Stock-based compensation
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company uses the fair-value based method of accounting for share-based compensation for all awards of shares and share options granted. Under the fair value based method, share-based awards to employees are measured at the fair value of the equity instrument issued as of the grant date using the Black-Scholes model and estimated forfeitures. The application of this pricing model requires management to estimate several variables, including the period for which the instrument is expected to be outstanding, price volatility of the Company's stock over the relevant timeframe, the determination of a relevant risk free interest rate, assumption regarding the Company's future dividend rate policy and estimate of the number of awards that will vest. Changes in one or more assumptions could materially impact the value derived for these equity instruments.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(e)&#160; Income taxes
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Income tax expense is comprised of current and deferred tax.&#160; Current tax and deferred tax are recognized into earnings except to the extent that it relates to a business combination, or items recognized directly in other comprehensive income.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Current tax is the expected tax payable or receivable on the taxable income or loss for the year, using tax rates enacted or substantively enacted at the reporting date, and any adjustment to tax payable in respect of previous years.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Deferred tax is recognized in respect of temporary differences between the carrying amounts of assets and liabilities for financial reporting purposes and the amounts used for taxation purposes.&#160; Deferred tax is not recognized for the following temporary differences: the initial recognition of assets or liabilities in a transaction that is not a business combination and that affects neither accounting nor taxable earnings, and differences relating to investments in subsidiaries and jointly controlled entities to the extent that it is probable that they will not reverse in the foreseeable future.&#160; In addition, deferred tax is not recognized for taxable temporary differences arising on the initial recognition of goodwill.&#160; Deferred tax is measured at the tax rates that are expected to be applied to temporary differences when they reverse, based on the laws that have been enacted or substantively enacted by the reporting date.&#160; Deferred tax assets and liabilities are offset if there is a legally enforceable right to offset current tax liabilities and assets, and they relate to income taxes levied by the same tax authority on the same taxable entity, or on different tax entities, but they intend to settle c
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	urrent tax liabilities and assets on a net basis or their tax assets and liabilities will be realized simultaneously.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
	20
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage126"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	A deferred tax asset is recognized for unused tax losses, tax credits and deductible temporary differences, to the extent that it is probable that future taxable profits will be available against which they can be utilized.&#160; Deferred tax assets are reviewed at each reporting date and are reduced to the extent that it is no longer probable that the related tax benefit will be realized.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	FUTURE CHANGES IN ACCOUNTING POLICIES
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	New standards and interpretations not yet applied:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	IFRS 9
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	- Financial Instruments:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	On July 24, 2014 the IASB issued the complete IFRS 9 (IFRS 9 (2014)).&#160; IFRS 9 (2014) introduces new requirements for the classification and measurement of financial assets. Under IFRS 9 (2014), financial assets are classified and measured based on the business model in which they are held and the characteristics of their contractual cash flows. The standard also introduces additional changes relating to financial liabilities and amends the impairment model by introducing a new 'expected credit loss' model for calculating impairment.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	IFRS 9 (2014) also includes a new general hedge accounting standard which aligns hedge accounting more closely with risk management. This new standard does not fundamentally change the types of hedging relationships or the requirement to measure and recognize ineffectiveness, however it will provide more hedging strategies that are used for risk management to qualify for hedge accounting and introduce more judgment to assess the effectiveness of a hedging relationship.&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Special transitional requirements have been set for the application of the new general hedging model.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company intends to adopt IFRS 9 (2014) in its financial statements for the annual period beginning on January 1, 2018. The extent of the impact of adoption of the standard has not yet been determined.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Annual Improvements to IFRS (2012 &#8211; 2014):
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	On September 25, 2014 the IASB issued narrow-scope amendments to a total of four standards as part of its annual improvements process. The amendments will apply for annual periods beginning on or after January 1, 2016. Earlier application is permitted, in which case, the related consequential amendments to other IFRSs would also apply. Each of the amendments has its own specific transition requirements.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Amendments were made to clarify the following in their respective standards:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="BD097BBF524C45549E14CA9B8E8980AA" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>

</TD>

	Changes in method for disposal under IFRS 5 Non-current Assets Held for Sale and Discontinued Operations;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT">

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
	21
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage127"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company intends to adopt these amendments in its financial statements for the annual period beginning on January 1, 2016. The Company does not expect the amendments to have a material impact on the financial statements.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; TEXT-INDENT: -18.55PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 36.55PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Disclosure Initiative:&#160; Amendments to IAS 1 &#8211;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Presentation of Financial Statements:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	On December 18, 2014 the IASB issued amendments to IAS 1
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Presentation of Financial Statements
</FONT>
	as part of its major initiative to improve presentation and disclosure in financial reports (the "Disclosure Initiative").&#160; The amendments are effective for annual periods beginning on or after 1 January 2016. Early adoption is permitted.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	These amendments will not require any significant change to current practice, but will facilitate improved financial statement disclosures.&#160;
</FONT>
	The Company intends to adopt these amendments in its financial statements for the annual period beginning on January 1, 2016. The extent of the impact of adoption of the amendments has not yet been determined.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	IFRS 15 -
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Revenue Recognition:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	On May 28, 2014 the IASB issued IFRS 15
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Revenue from Contracts with Customers.
</FONT>
	&#160; The new standard is effective for annual periods beginning on or after January 1, 2018. Earlier application is permitted.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	IFRS 15 will replace IAS 11
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Construction Contracts
</FONT>
	, IAS 18
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Revenue,
</FONT>
	IFRIC 13
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Customer Loyalty Programmes
</FONT>
	, IFRIC 15
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Agreements for the Construction of Real Estate
</FONT>
	, IFRIC 18
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Transfer of Assets from Customers
</FONT>
	, and SIC 31
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Revenue &#8211; Barter Transactions Involving Advertising Services.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The standard contains a single model that applies to contracts with customers and two approaches to recognising revenue: at a point in time or over time. The model features a contract-based five-step analysis of transactions to determine whether, how much and when revenue is recognized.&#160; New estimates and judgmental thresholds have been introduced, which may affect the amount and/or timing of revenue recognized.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The new standard applies to contracts with customers. It does not apply to insurance contracts, financial instruments or lease contracts, which fall in the scope of other IFRSs.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company intends to adopt IFRS 15 in its financial statements for the annual period beginning on January 1, 2018. The extent of the impact of adoption of the standard has not yet been determined.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	IFRS 16 &#8211;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Leases:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In January 2016, the IASB issued IFRS 16 &#8211; Leases, which supersedes IAS 17 &#8211; Leases. IFRS 16 establishes principles for the recognition, measurement, presentation and disclosure of leases. The standard establishes a single model for lessees to bring leases on-balance sheet while lessor accounting remains largely unchanged and retains the finance and operating lease distinctions. IFRS 16 is effective for annual periods beginning on or after January 1, 2019, with earlier adoption permitted, but only if also applying IFRS 15 &#8211; Revenue from contracts with Customers. The Company is currently evaluating the impact on IFRS 16 on its financial statements.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
	22
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage128"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	FINANCIAL INSTRUMENTS
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company's financial instruments consist of cash and cash equivalents, trade and other receivables, trade and other payables, employee benefit obligations, short term advances, notes payable and bank indebtedness, and the Company's earn-out obligation.&#160; The fair values of these financial instruments, except the notes payable balances and the earn-out obligation, approximate carrying value because of their short-term nature. The earn-out obligation arising from the Company's acquisition of GAA is classified as a financial liability recorded at fair value through earnings.&#160; For all other debt balances, the fair value of these financial instruments approximates carrying value; the Scotia Facility is a floating rate instrument and due to the subordinate nature of the Crown Note, management has assessed that the carrying value of this fixed rate instrument reflects fair value.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Cash and cash equivalents and trade and other receivables are classified as loans and receivables, which are measured at amortized cost.&#160; Trade and other payables, employee benefit obligations and short term advances are classified as other financial liabilities, which are measured at amortized cost.&#160; Notes payable balances and bank indebtedness, excluding the earn-out obligation, are measured at amortized cost.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company's financial instruments are exposed to certain financial risks, including credit risk, liquidity risk and market risk.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; TEXT-INDENT: -36PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Credit risk
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Credit risk is the risk of financial loss to the Company if counterparty to a financial instrument fails to meet its contractual obligations and arises principally from the Company's cash and cash equivalents, and trade receivables.&#160; The carrying amount of the financial assets represents the maximum credit exposure.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company limits its exposure to credit risk on cash and cash equivalents by placing these financial instruments with high-credit quality financial institutions and only investing in liquid, investment grade securities.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company has a number of individual customers and no one customer represents a concentration of credit risk.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The carrying amount of trade receivables is reduced through the use of an allowance account and the amount of the loss is recognized in the income statement within operating expenses.&#160; When a receivable balance is considered uncollectible it is written off against the allowance.&#160; Subsequent recoveries of amounts previously written off are credited against operating expenses in the income statement.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	No one customer accounts for more than 10% of the Company's consolidated revenue.&#160; Credit risk associated with the collection of receivables is considered low.&#160;
<FONT STYLE="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company establishes a provision for losses on accounts receivable if it is determined that all or part of the outstanding balance is uncollectable.&#160; Collectability is reviewed regularly and an allowance is established or adjusted, as necessary, using a combination of the specific identification method and historic collection patterns.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The carrying amount of financial assets represents the maximum credit exposure.&#160; The maximum exposure to credit risk at the reporting date was:
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
	23
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage129"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Liquidity risk
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Liquidity risk is the risk that the Company will not be able to meet its financial obligations as they come due.&#160; The Company ensures that there is sufficient liquidity to meet its short-term business requirements, taking into account its anticipated cash flows from operations and its holdings of cash as well as unused credit facilities.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
	24
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage130"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Market risk
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Market risk is the risk that changes in market prices, such as foreign currency exchange rates and interest rates will affect the Company's income or the value of the financial instruments held.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="12C67AD9B9964191A382059E33BB75E7" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 14.2PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 14.15PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	i
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	Foreign currency risk:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 28.35PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The majority of the Company's sales and purchases are made in U.S. dollars.&#160; However, certain of the Company's revenues and expenses are denominated in Canadian dollars.&#160; Foreign currency risk reflects the risk that the Company's earnings will be impacted by fluctuations in exchange rates.&#160; During the year ended December&#160;31, 2015, approximately 0.4% (2014 &#8211; 1.4%) of the Company's sales were made in Canadian dollars and approximately 14% (2014 - 35%) of expenses was incurred in Canadian dollars.&#160; With all other variables held constant, a 10% point increase in the value of the Canadian dollar relative to the U.S. dollar would have decreased net income by approximately $309,000 (2014 - $293,000) for the year ended December&#160;31, 2015.&#160; There would be an equal and opposite impact on the net income with a 10% point decrease in the value of the Canadian dollar relative to the U.S.&#160;dollar.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 28.35PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	At December&#160;31, 2015, the Company has Canadian dollar denominated working capital as well as a Canadian dollar denominated loan.&#160; Foreign exchange gains and losses arising from the revaluation of these balances are included in net income or earnings.&#160; With all other variables held constant, a 10% point increase in the value of the Canadian dollar relative to the U.S. dollar would have decreased net income by approximately $1,454,000 (2014 - $2,561,000) for the year ended December&#160;31, 2015, based on the net working capital position and loan balances held in Canadian dollars.&#160; There would be an equal and opposite impact on the net income with a 10% point decrease in the value of the Canadian dollar relative to the U.S.&#160;dollar.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 28.35PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The objective of the Company's foreign exchange risk management activities is to minimize transaction exposures and the resulting volatility of the Company's earnings.&#160; The Company manages this risk by pricing sales in U.S. dollars or the currency of the expenses being incurred.&#160; The Company has not entered into any forward foreign exchange contracts as at December 31 2015.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; TEXT-INDENT: 28.35PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company is exposed to currency risk on the following:
</DIV>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2PX SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF; WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM" VALIGN="BOTTOM" NOWRAP="NOWRAP">
	&#160;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.15PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Interest rate risk
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company's policy is to invest cash and equivalents at floating rates of interest, in order to maintain liquidity, while achieving a satisfactory return for the Company.&#160; Fluctuations in interest rates impact the value of cash equivalents.&#160; The Company's interest bearing liabilities are fixed rate instruments, except for its Scotia Facility. Fluctuations in market interest rates will have no significant impact on the Company's fixed rate debt instruments, but may impact the fair value of such instruments at any given date.&#160; With respect to the Company's Scotia Facility, with all other variables held constant, a 10% point increase in the interest rate would have reduced net income by approximately $5,000 (2014 - $nil) for the year ended December&#160;31, 2015.&#160; There would be an equal and opposite impact on the net income with a 10% point decrease.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
	25
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage131"></A>
</DIV>
</EFX_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">

<EFX_LEGAL_PROCEEDINGS>
<A NAME="FIS_LEGAL_PROCEEDINGS_2"></A>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	LEGAL PROCEEDINGS
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company is a party to a variety of agreements in the ordinary course of business under which it may be obligated to indemnify third parties with respect to certain matters.&#160; These obligations include, but are not limited to contracts entered into with physicians where the Company agrees, under certain circumstances, to indemnify a third party, against losses arising from matters including but not limited to medical malpractice and product liability.&#160; The impact of any such future claims, if made, on future financial results is not subject to reasonable estimation because considerable uncertainty exists as to final outcome of these potential claims.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
	26
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage132"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	NON-IFRS MEASUREMENTS
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The following are non-IFRS measures and investors are cautioned not to place undue reliance on them and are urged to read all IFRS accounting disclosures present in the consolidated financial statements and accompanying notes for the consolidated financial statements for the year ended December 31, 2015.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company uses certain non-IFRS financial measures as supplemental indicators of its financial and operating performance. These non-IFRS financial measures include Operating EBITDA and Operating expenses - adjusted. The Company believes these supplementary financial measures reflect the Company's ongoing business in a manner that allows for meaningful period-to-period comparisons and analysis of trends in its business. These non-IFRS measures do not have any standardized meaning prescribed under IFRS and are therefore unlikely to be comparable to similar measures presented by other companies.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company defines Operating EBITDA as operating earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and related expenses, amortization, stock based compensation, acquisition related expenses and asset impairment charges.&#160; Operating EBITDA is presented on a basis consistent with the Company's internal management reports. The Company discloses Operating EBITDA to capture the profitability of its business before the impact of items not considered in management's evaluation of operating unit performance.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company defines Operating expenses - adjusted as operating expenses before acquisition related expenses, stock based compensation, depreciation and related expenses, amortization and asset impairment charges.&#160; Operating expenses - adjusted is presented on a basis consistent with the Company's internal management reports.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The non-IFRS measures are reconciled to reported IFRS figures in the tables below:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14PT">
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="EB6ADE88148A46DF8F9EE0EC289F35B8" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

	1.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">

</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="A59B088BA74E44D69D86FD1B1798AF24" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="00BF6EA51BC642FE985190BEE38AD912" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of operations and cash flows of the issuer as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="5150E40CFF8E4179854A09BD7BFCC94F" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	The issuer's other certifying officer(s) and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f)) for the issuer and have:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="B18D03017B08495889E3E662DBDAD0DF" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>

	(a)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	Designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating to the issuer, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="BA16D50913804C4D809166EC9A9D9B6D" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

	(b)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	Designed such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="A2D3BDCF4F4D403496E453ADB740462E" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="07DB3ECC66284F8BBA1C5DECDE10DAD6" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	Disclosed in this report any change in the issuer's internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the period covered by the annual report that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the issuer's internal control over financial reporting; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="7E2F46DEE0AD420B997CB0FAD6E248C6" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">

</TD>
</TR>

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	I, Richard Bear, certify that:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="33B03106C1F94FE5B88820553AAC9495" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	1.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	I have reviewed this annual report on Form 40&#8209;F of CRH Medical Corporation;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="2C4250ABAA104F57A5DFC7752ED13725" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	2.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="77E9FA9B0F594FF9852BCEA5F802C0BE" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	3.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of operations and cash flows of the issuer as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="FD8201292FCB4D8884A7D4DBFED1D576" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	4.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	The issuer's other certifying officer(s) and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f)) for the issuer and have:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="20AC4063F7D74160AA3479751216CCF6" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	Designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating to the issuer, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="86919FE1571643D6A9CCF0E3AFA22BF1" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">

</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	Designed such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="AC188AD850A64125B5BC1D12786FE4C4" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="A013A6B28B96492BA3217DA5A1D17E66" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="683A595620374B5D90A8200D7E513F66" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

</TD>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">

</TD>
</TR>

<A NAME="FIS_CERTIFICATION_2"></A>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	CERTIFICATION OF CEO AND CFO
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<BR>
</FONT>
	PURSUANT TO SECTION 906 OF THE SARBANES-OXLEY ACT OF 2002
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In connection with the annual report of CRH Medical Corporation (the "Registrant") filed under cover of Form 40&#8209;F for the period ended December 31, 2015, as filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission on the date hereof (the "Report"), Edward Wright, as Chief Executive Officer of the Registrant, and Richard Bear, as Chief Financial Officer of the Registrant, each hereby certifies, pursuant to 18 U.S.C. &#167;1350, as adopted pursuant to &#167; 906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, to the best of his knowledge that:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="705B6DCA91BE47DF9BB3718547832D66" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV>
	The Report fully complies with the requirements of section 13(a) or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended; and
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="A02D982E4F1A44A3AAC0E796D5B2352D" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>

	&#160;
